column5: Draught at "Salone della Birra Artigianale 2007" - Milan. Slightly dark yellow color light and fine fizz. Light and homogenous head of short resistance. Fresh and flowery scent with herbaceous and spiced notes which anise and dried malt. Typical taste, bitterish and slightly smooths down. Modest final body with pleasant alcoholic content.
Can. Pours a deep brown. Berry fruit on the nose. Plenty of fruit in the mouth as well. Quite a rich palate, some hints of wood. Quite suppable.

Draught at the brewery. Shiny, glowing red-amber with a rock head. Bubbly. Faint aroma of cherry and minerals. Rich caramel flavor—sweet, with a bit of chocolate and a bitter finish. Caramel is a bit funky. Earthy, wit minerals and butter. Falls behind their other beers.

Medium light beige shiny creamy head. Amber body. Metallic wooden caramel aroma. Taste is sweetish roasty caramel with floral notes. Dryish caramel aftertaste. Not bad, but a bit boring. (0.35l on draft.)

Golden color with an outstanding lovely nose. I just love beer with raw sewage, cornstarch and unknown chemicals. Like a science experiment and who doesn’t like experiments? Light body and now I can taste these mysterious lovely adjuncts I smelt in the nose. AWESOME. Too bad the finish is tasteless, I was hoping for so much more.

My Bottom Line: Herbal hops and complacent cereals achieve balance in this simple and effective Pilsener which might lack crispness. Further Personal Perceptions: -A veil of foam tops the clear golden. -A light whiff of diacetyl vanishes soon enough. -The herbal, spicy hop bitterness is subdued, but logically follows the flavor profile. -The prickly carbonation enlivens the svelte body. Bottle; best before July 10th (had on June 24th).

Medium shiny offwhite coarse head. Deep yellow body with carbonation. Vague, mealy apple aroma. Dry, full, fruity malty taste with notes of apple, straw, and paper. Dry, grassy paper aftertaste. Nothing special about this one. (0.33l bottle.)

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear deep yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet flowers and light malt. Flavor of crackery malt (very malty) and a bitter hops finish. Decent malty beer. I had this about a year ago and didn’t like it at all, but this time around I did enjoy it. 7/4/7/4/14 (3.6/5)

A pale wheaty haze and a film of foam that looks like a cartographer had something to do with it. Very little aroma here bar some dusty cereals. Sweet with hints of deep fruit. Quite Belgian or BDG flavours. It has a nice spicy sweet finish. Quite still but with a good oily texture and nice residue. Sweet. Laid back and low down?

A hazy golden ale with a thin creamy white head. A light sweet aroma with faint hops and honey. In mouth, a light yet pleasaing fruity ale with light notes of ginger. Rather light but interesting. On tap at brewpub, Inbièrenationale IV, May 2007.

On tap at the brewpub. Definitely it’s own beast. Aroma not terribly strong, floral hops, a malt base most reminiscent of caramel malt, but somewhat more roasted. Flavor opens up more, bittering hops, charred/tar-like malt, bitter coffee, bitter chocolate, honey. Got a bit tiring by glass’s end with its weird second-running character exhibiting more and more of that tar aspect. Still, very interesting, and not half bad.

Soft off-white head that leaves nice lacing, atop lightly hazed light amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, chocolate, rye, grapefruit, some caramel. Taste is medium sweet, chocolate, rye, grapefruit, some caramel. Light-medium body.
On tap at the Brewpub. Pours cloudy amber in color with off white head. Aroma is malty and light floral hops. Taste of malt and light citrus hops with a grapefruit bitter finish.
on tap-pours a foamy offwhite head with cloudy/hazy amber color. Aroma is faint spicy hops, medium malt. Taste is spicy hops, medium malt.
Pours amber with sparse off white carbonation. Smells of some earthy hops and sweet malt. Taste is slightly watery with some elements of roses and oranges. A bit on the weak side.
Robe blonde voilée aux reflets gris sans mousse. Arômes de houblon aromatique. Saveurs de malt caramel, de houblon aromatique et de levures.

Shared by mkgrenwel at DLD. Lighty aroma, honey and some fruitiness. Hazy golden brown color with a medium palate. The taste follows the aroma exactly. Pretty easy to drink and solid for a second runnings brew.

Mild cloudy golden body with a minimal collapsing white head. Aroma is peach, Bellini. Taste is fruity, mild hearty. Dry but fruity finish. Medium body, soft carbonation oily texture. Not very sour,but very nice beer

many Thanks for this traditional beer to Koelschtrinker. Poured into Barenbier Berliner Weisse glass. Niemal bez piany, brudnawa metnawo-piaskowa barwa, z lekkim zapachem nadpsutych papierowek lezacych w trawie. W smaku kwasek, sok kwasny z jablek, nieco przyprawy jakiejs. Dziwne nieco.
$6.49 bottle, WM-CHO. Slightly hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is faint, but what's there is lemon zest, wheat. Flavor is tart wheat, lemon zest, bread crust.

( on tap) Aroma: sweet peaches, lemon Taste: sweet, lightly sour, flavour of sweet peaches and stone fruits. Palate: medium body, chewy, strong carbonation. Overall: Probably the best clear Berliner weisse i have ever tried.
Perfect summer beer. Light but juicy with a mashed wheaty texture and citrus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, pours a hazy yellow golden with fizzy white head. Notes are straightforward for style: wet dog, lactic lemons, wheat, and other funk. Body is on the light side. Tart finish. On tap at Brauhaus, so much better: apples, lemons, lactic wheat, balanced with light tartness. I moved it up
01-06-19 // taster at Berliner Weisse Gipfel. Hazyliy yellwosih. Lemon zesty funky. Mild sourness. Mild lacto. Good one.
Bottle at Hy-Vee Oktoberfest 2018. Poured hazed light golden, white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit. Taste was sweet, tart, lemon, sour, fruit.

Bottle in Seattle. Always a treat, and this bottle is a little over a year old. Clear pale yellow, very small head. Nose of chewy, sweet wheat and some lactic tartness. Exceptionally clean, delicious, lightly tart acidity on the first sip. Some creamy wheat character develops and rounds the body. Some lactic/diacetyl character persists but well in balance. Lovely balanced tartness at finish, and lingers as dry acidity. A very nice example of style, and delicate.
500ml bottle @ home. Slightly hazy yellow with big, fluffy white head. Nice funky sour nose. Flavors are tart lemon citrus, mild funk, some earthy malt. Light and refreshing, great beer for summer.

Aroma of sour apples. Refreshing, light sour taste, a bit watery, with almost no sweetness. Much less sweet than most other Ebbelwois, almost tastes like it has already been mixed with water, as some people like to drink their Ebbelwoi.
Many thanks for this apfel cider to Mariusz. Jasna barwa. Pachnie smazonymi jablkami. Smakowo wodnisty kompot gruszkowo jablkowy
Säuerlich fruchtiger Apfelantrunk. Weich, die Apfelnoten bleiben konstant. Trocken, vollmundig, reif. Gut. 8/9/9/9//9
100cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with no head. Aroma of ripe old apples, some tartness. Taste of dry tart apples, old apples, average!

1L "im Bembel-Look" from MaruhnXII/2015, bought for a pulled pork recipe... Contains and wears the added antioxidant sulphuroxide on its sleeve: yellow apple peel in Gutedel white wine, thinnish rather than the advertised vollmundig, more diluted cider vinegar than cider-y: is this apple derivate even related to cidre? Weißweinschorle and Apfelschorle (finally/ never the twain shall) meet, with a dash of lemon.

1L bottle from Beers of Europe. Pale golden colour, no head and aroma of apple, rubber. Taste is juicy apple, sweetish & tart with rubber, leather and white wine notes. Thin mouthfeel, light bodied, medium carbonation, fairly clean finish. Quite OK.

Um einiges besser als so mancher Frankfurter, der die letzten Monate so im Test war. Nertte Balance aus Saeure und Sueffigkeit. Dahinter ein paar unreife Aepfel nebst leichter Grasigkeit und Zitrone. Nicht schlecht.

Bottle from IxI Getränkemarkt in Frankfurt. The Apfelwein has got a clear golden colour with a medium body. No carbonation. Aroma of harsh apples and trees. Taste of green apples, citric, leaces, acid, unripe red apples and trees. Refreshing. Enjoyed it.

Many thanks to McTapps for this sample. Golden in the glass with a slightly stinky nose. The cider starts fresh and sourish. Nice balanced with moderate fruity sourness. Very dry with no tannins there. Fresh, smooth, easy to drink with still a rest of sweetness to remain highly drinkable. Nice typical Frankfurt-cider.

1 litre bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours light golden yellow with a sweetcorn / apple skin aroma. Taste is very much on the light side with a thin sourness and watery green apple tint. Tastes a bit weak & watered down. Not great.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Malt Shovel Northampton. A straw yellow coloured beer with an off-white head and a little lacing. The aroma is sweetish with some phenols, and a touch of wheatiness. The taste is more of the same. More phemols and more sweetness. A little lemony note. Not to my taste.
Golden beer with a small white head. The aroma is fairly weak, but it has notes of a sourness. The flavour is watery with light notes of wheat and an annoying sourness.
From Ølgod Bryghus, DK. Bottled, 200612. Yellow with white head. Aroma of wheat and banana. Flavour with cloves and other spices.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy golden with a medium off white head. The aroma is marmelade, old fruit, vegetables and a strange sour notes. The flavour is highly bitter and has a strong vegy overall sourness. Its completely ruined and horrible. Best before Dec 2012 so not old at all. Bad brewing!

Sample from a bottle. light yellow with a medium white head. The aroma contains notes of wheat, and a tight sulfur smell. The taste bear the imprint of sulfur and is both sour and bitter, so something must have gone wrong

Had this on tap at Ølgod Bryghus, Ølgod, Denmark, 08.04.11 Pours yellow in colour with a white filmy head. Wheaty, touch fruity with some traces of lemon and a surprising harshness, bit dry. Its ok. A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov12 3.0

Bottled @Beer Hunters (BB 06/2011) Hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma has some fruit sugars, orange and yeast, slightly cardboadish too. Light to medium-bodied. Slightly sour. Wheat, cardboard, citrus in the flavor. A bit infected?
Bottle.Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head.Some citrus in the nose ,and a little sweat.Dry and sour in the mouth.There is some malt and hops.Infected ,I’m sorry to say.
Bottle. Golden -orange colour with a white head. Aroma is dry, malt, citrus, orange. Flavour is sweet, malt, hop, citrus, orange, sour. Medium body. Some thing is wrong here.

Bottle. A slightly hazy, orange beer with a minimal-sized white head. Slightly sourish and chalky on the nose, with a sourish fruityness dominating. The aroma is also a bit too sourish, infected-style, with sourish fruits, a chalky touch and some hops to give bitterness. Medium body, quite low on carbonation, and with a lemony finish. Even though it’s a bit off, it’s sure drinkable, but I see no reason to buy it again. 090720

Draught@brewpub. Hazy golden/orange colour, not much head. Aroma is sweet wheat as well as some mild sugary notes. Also mild grainyness. Flavour is a bit acidic fruity and wheaty with some hints of hops. Quite harsh grassy finish.

Draught @ Ølgod Bryghus. Pours hazy brown with a creamy tan head, lacings. Aroma of malt, light roast, bread, little coffee, caramel. Flavor is light sweet, malty, caramel, coffee, bread, light chocolate. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 181019
Fin malte duft, flot farve men smagen er lidt "tynd" og svag. Den holder ikke til krydret leverpostej eller spegepølse. Har lidt en tendens til at smage lidt surt. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Roasted malt and raisins. Flavour: Dark roasted malt with coffee and slight raisins. Some fruity sweetness. Colour: Dark brown with an offwhite head. From: Bottle @ Superbrugsen Ansager Jun. 2016
en god øl med en sødlig duft har et meget fint lysebrunt skum, som holder længe farven er flot mørk gylden smagen er lidt sødlig en øl der ikke rykker
En god og ordinær schwarzbier fra Ølgod. Tilpas med sødme og friskhed. Savner nogte humliesmag.
Clear brown beer with a small beige head. Aroma is fruity and roasted malt. Taste is sour with notes of roasted malts and coffee.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a medium off white head. The aroma is roasted malt and liquorice. Light tobacco. The flavour is liquirice, pepper, light puke and hard roasted malt. Not fund of this.
From Ølgod Bryghus, DK. Bottled, 200612. Brown with beige head. Aroma of malt and coffee. Flavour with roasted maæt and caramel.

Had this on tap at Ølgod Bryghus, Ølgod, Denmark, 08.04.11 There is a little sourness in the mouth, soft mouthfeel. There is a tangy fruitiness. This pours looking like a flat cola soft drink. Its fine but not really offering too much. To be honest I was not entirely certain what style this was. A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov12 3.0

Bottle, bought @ SuperSpar, Ølgod. Fine, clear, dark red, bordering on black. Lovely, staying, creamy, off-white head. Mild sweet aroma, some caramel, lightly toasted. Highish carbonation, fair mouthfeel. Flavour has some light milky notes, mild smokey. Light caramel, some chocolate. Light infection. Not impressive.

Draught @ Ølgod Bryghus. Pours clear light golden with a white head, light lacings. Aroma of malt, grain, grass, light citrus. Flavor is light bitter, malty, grain, light grass, light citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 181019

Aroma: fruits with citrus and yeast. Flavour: sweet fruits and a tangy sourness with grapelike slightly dry finish. Colour: pale yellow with a white head. From: bottle @ superbrugsen in Ansager Jun. 2016.
smagen er noget sød har et fint hvidt skum dufter godt af humle farven er lys brun den har bundfald, og er svær at skænke der går en 4del tabt :(:(:( har smagt den og det var det.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is citric hops, light paint and caramel. The flavour is fruity and quite sour. Infected indeed.
From Ølgod Bryghus, DK. Bottled, 200612. Yellow with white head. Aroma of hay and citrus. Flavour with malt.

Had this on tap at Ølgod Bryghus, Ølgod, Denmark, 08.04.11 Pours lemony yellow in colour with a white head. Soft carbonation in mouth, touch of mineral, and just a little metallic, cereal sweetness, some lemon and other citrus fruitiness detected. This is probably one of the better beers from this brewery bit sweetish maybe but quite tasty. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4

Bottle, bought @ SPAR, Ølgod. Clear, light hazy pale golden with a big, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is a bit funky, some grass, light maltiness, light lactic acid. High carbonation, dryish and a bit thin. Flavour is mild lactic, mild metallic, some grassy dry bitterness, mild maltiness. Mild infection.

Bottled 500ml (Beer Hunters, BB 05/2011) Hazy orange color, steady small white head. Grainy nose with hints of citrus and acidity. Medium-bodied. Flavor is similar to aroma: grapefruity, citrus acidity. Some metallic and grainy notes.
Bottle at Chris’ Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia tasting. Gusher, hazy pale gold. Thin white head. OK pale malt aroma, some hop. It’s an ok pils ok lager, some hop on end.
22nd May 2010. ChrisOs ’Blue Ridge Mountains Of Virginia’ tasting! Hazy gold beer. Light dry palate - soft edges. Slightly sour malt. A dash of lenon. A little caraway. Finishes dry. Passable.

On tap at the brewery. This was the worst of the flight, ultra bland, watery. Not much taste or aroma, no body to speak of. Slice of orange added nothing to it either. Looking at the ratings, not sure if this batch was bad, but it was truly bad.
On tap at brewpub. Pours out a hazy light yellow topped with a nice tiny white head. Pretty good aroma of yeast. Not to bad.

Tap (Belgian Wheat): Pours a hazy golden color, a little white head. The nose is bright with raw dough and light yeast, some citrus notes (maybe from the orange that was thrust unto my beverage) and some vanilla lotionish thing. The flavor is plenty balanced, nice light acidity. Overall and clean yeast example with not quite enough carbonation as desired. I liked this a lot better than the IIPA.

On Tap at the brewpub. Hazy light orange/yellow with just a thin skin of an off-white head and traces of thin lacing down the sides. Light banana orange aroma and flavor. Light malt/wheat flavor with a light soft unfiltered feel. Lacking any bitterness. Not Bad.
Tap at brewpub: Banana aroma with cloudy gold appearance and typical bready yeast flavors. Ok.

On tap at brewpub. Pours out a nice amber color topped with a small head. Very little hop aroma on this one. But is followed up with a GREAT big Hop dissapointment. They call this a 2IPA. I think there normal IPA is much better.

Tap: Poured an amber color with very little lacing. The nose is citrusy and musky with a bit of charcoal and a light malt note, some chemical, but very light, almost as if it weren’t even there. The nose otherwise though is a bit light for an Imperial IPA. The flavor isn’t even that malty either. It is stronger in gravity for sure, but it’s just lacking in intensity. Finishes clean and drinkable, but I want my double IPAs to be a bit more brash. I like em tough.

On Tap at the brewpub Medium clear golden amber witha coarse light tan head and spotty lacing. Average moderatly hoppy flavor fairly balanced I suppose but mediocre in all respects. Certainly not very "Double". Their regular IPA was tastier and much more hoppy.

Tap at brewpub: Clear gold with white head. It has a stuffy hop aroma that seems to be waiting to burst forth with exuberant delight, but is being held back. So that’s a bummer. You can also pick up on some grass clippings. I expected it to pack way more of a punch being an 2IPA, but it doesn’t. Needs a little work and it could be a good brew.

22oz bottle. Small off-white head atop murky amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, yeasty, honey, some pepper. Taste is moderately sweet, flower, honey, some pepper, light medicinal. Light-medium body, light stickiness.

Bomber from Brewforia. Pours very hazy orange with a strange layer of white bubbles. Aroma is rather yeasty. Medium body with very light carbonation. Flavor is sweetish citrus/toffee. Underlying funk? Hard to tell. Maybe this is diacetyl. Or maybe the honey is confusing me. It is certainly unlike any Biere de Garde I can recall. It takes some getting used to. Finishes toffee to me.

This 22 oz bottle came from Paul’s Grocery in McCall, Idaho. It poured a hazy golden color with a really nice looking fat white head and good lacing. Nose of grainy malts and some unidentifiable spices and floral hops. Medium mouthfeel. Complex flavors with malts, yeasts, and an earthy touch. Dry finish with a touch of bitterness. Nice easy drinking beer with lots of character.

Bomber courtesy of Jake65 - thanks! Lightly hazed gold with a big off white head that gets rocky quickly. Looks well carbonated. Decent nose - lightly fruity, dusty, mild yeastiness, lightly grainy. Good drippy lace. Mild fruity flavors, a touch of toastiness, light earth, yeast. Floral and honey hints. Good stuff.

Bottle thanks to Toby. Pours out a hazy golden/straw color with a rather large foamy, slightly off white head. Aroma is of some spice and some grainy malty notes. Taste is complex, fruits, spice, yeast with some light earthy notes slight malty and honey sweetness in there also, drinkable and rather solid.

Bottle: Hazy yellow pour with a large off-white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is a bit obstrusive with some metallic notes and a funky malty feel. Some bits of floral and earthiness as well. Taste is more floral than malt... Just a little lingering earthy feel. Not quite right.

Sampled 10/22/08. This Biere de Garde pours a medium yellow gold color from a 22oz bottle. Medium to large sized long lasting white foamy head, with good retention. The aroma is fruity and sweet, banana and yeast, with some honey. A medium bodied Biere de Garde. The malts are fruity and very sweet, lots of banana flavors. The hops are earthy and a touch floral. Lively carbonation. It’s a touch too sweet and seems to be missing some of the spiciness of a Biere de Garde. There are some interesting honey flavors going on here. Drinkable but a little too sweet for my tastes. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is sweet.
2008 Bottle - Pours pale yellow with a huge white head...aroma is grains, yeast, banana and spice, heavy malt...flavour follows, decent balance, coats the mouth but is short lasting...pretty nice

NABA 08’: Pours a copper color with a white head. The nose is strong with esters and belgian yeast, quite a bit banana with some candi sugar, special b and lots of medicinal notes. The flavor is sweet and cloying, not enough carbonation for this attenuation level. Wheaty body and mouthfeel. Not as subtle and refreshing as I like.
On tap at Pandora brew pub - Trail Creek brewery. Light, refreshing, very bready, and a tad sweet. Not bad
From a 600 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Aroma of grain and some caramel. Flavors are sweet butterscotch with no bitter hop presence.
Uma pilsen discreta, leve e refrescante. Um pouco aguada, boa pare ser tomada em dias quentes.
Melhor que a Witbier da cervejaria Theresópolis, mas ainda é bastante comum. Comprei na promoção e achei o preço justo, mas normalmente é muito cara para o que realmente entrega
Cerveja clara e leve. Bem fácil de ser encontrada, mas n vale o custo/benefício.
Está entre as melhores pilseners de larga escala de fabricação produzidas no Brasil. E o brasileiro adora pilsen. Então pra tomar num sábado com a família e amigos é uma ótima pedida.
Cerveja com grife, mas bem comum. Não difere muito das cervejas produzidas em grande escala. Não vale o preço.

600ml bottle. Clear pale yellow with white head. Aroma is sweet malts and some slight almost acidic bitterness. Taste is similar with the same light acidic bitterness and light sweet maltiness. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and fairly non-district aftertaste.

A Therezópolis Gold é uma Premium Lager muito boa. Esta é uma cerveja refrescante e de fácil apreciação. A receita é de origem dinamarquesa e faz valer o título de Premium pois é perceptível a concentração superior de malte, mas bem equilibrado com o médio amargor. Por fim, a cerveja tem uma ótima textura e uma belíssima cor dourada. Sua espuma e consistente e de média duração, sendo cremosa e generosa.

Bottle. Pours dirty yellow with a small white head. Light nose, malty, caramel, spices and a light floral note. Starts light sweet and turns pleasently bitter in the finish. Light body and high carbonation with quite sparkling mouthfeel. Crisp and refreshing. Flavor is light as well mostly malts with a caramel note and just a hint of a floral hop note. Leaves a very light aftertaste. Overall easy drinking and fresh, with a potential for long nights without being flat.
Aroma de mel e caramelo. Espuma vom boa formação e persistência, com bolhas medias a grandes. Sabor residual doce. Alto drinkability.

On cask at the 1/27/07 Atlanta Cask Ale Tasting: Clear golden bronze with thin frothy white head. Oaky, earthy noble hop aroma has some vanilla and diacetyl. Body starts lightly sweet and malty with a good, oaky balance toward a crisp, clean finish. A nicely-balanced and unique brew.

I see a few other ratings mention the sour aspect, but not many, so I’m not sure if this is intentional or not, but there is a dominant sour note reminiscent of Belgian yeast. Dark brown with brown head. Malty and smokey flavour, with a sour barrel aged woody taste.
Quite enjoyed this. Pours black with tan head. Smells faintly like smoke and some brett. Smoky flavours with a sour cherry and brett finish. Thin palate, but still really nice.
Not smoky at all but rather sweet. Drinks alright but not smooth enough and unnecessary aftertaste.

500ml bottle pours black in color with a small light brown head which leaves a thin ring on the surface but very little lacing. Aroma is quite smoky with some roasted grains and hints of chocolate. Taste is also smoky with a roasted malt bitterness and chocolate malty sweetness and mild hop bitterness that fades to more smoke and a little alcohol burn. A very nicely done smoked porter.

Good solid beer from one of the better brewers in Japan. Light smoke, this more about the poter underneath. Lots of chocolate an oily flint like body and a coffee espresso lite finish. Well put together.

A lovely smoked porter. Blackish body with minimal sixteenth of an inch of off-white head. Smokey aroma. Above average mouthfeel of peaty smoke, substantial smoke flavour and very porterish. Balanced, not over the top tasty stuff, malted backbone that makes it emminently drinkable.500 ml. from Presario.

This... doesn’t smell like smoke... at first. I stuck my nose into my ginormous glass as I poured expecting to smell BBQ aromas but it was mostly tinny can and some decomposing fruits. A bit later on the smoke aroma does come through though, you have to wait for it to warm up to you a little. It looks like an imperial porter(double dark) but with just a bit of head on pour and then it clears up quickly. This does taste fine enough, but if you were blind tasting you wouldn’t put the word Imperial in the description. After sitting a bit it does seem a bit oily and the smoke is really evident in the nose and flavour,it’s not quite overpowering, but the oiliness sure pushes the smoke agenda down your mouth hole. The % lingers on the tongue for just a moment before slipping away beneath the smoky depths. This is going to go very well with my seasonal BBQ’d steak, thank goodness for the chinook winds that allows me to BBQ in winter! (and for chinook hops, I also give much thanks!)

The pre-open prediction on this one: this should be one of the worst things I’ve opened all year. Well, I was quite wrong. Pretty much black - came out oily with a small dark brown cap that is creamy leaving spotty lacing. Excellent smoke aroma! Damn. Chocolate beyond the smoke, light fruit, hint of herbal. This is not quite overpowering but it’s close but I dig it. Smoky flavour, a bit sweet with some nice fruit, chocolate, nuts. Smooth feel. A gagging cough produced a hard smoke belch and tears.

My second smoked style beer. The pour is deep opaque black with a creamy everlasting beige head. Aroma is overly smoky with hints of caramel, nuts, huge roasted malts and alcohol. The taste is sweet, smooth malts with a not so subtle smoke taste on top. Nice alcohol burn (not that 7% is much of an Imperial style ABV) on the finish. Overall, a pretty solid beer.

In short: A chocolaty smoked with a strong fresh mint and perfume flavor. This is fucked up. How: Bottle 500ml. Consumed when probably 6 months to 1 year of age. Sent to me by presario. Thanks a lot Trevor The look: Black body topped by a very small tan head In long: Strange smoky nose. Lots of smoked but also weird scented notes of fresh mint leafs. Taste is smoky, meaty, lots of fresh mint leafs, milk chocolate, soya sauce, perfume. Very sweet. A clash of stuff. I’m not saying that flavors of fresh mint leafs and perfume cannot work in a beer. But that really did not work here. This bottle was an absolute mess. No sign of infection or oxidation at all. So I’m assuming that what I got was a “normal” bottle. Holly crap, this was one of the weirdest thing I ever had. And I’ve had lots of weird shit. The blend of flavors in this beer is gross, that’s Lay’s making potatoes chips with flavors of Sour Cream and Onions!!! Can you imagine that?
Medium white head. Hazy pale yellow body. Acidic mealy citric spicy aroma. Citric mealy sweetish spicy coriander taste. Dryish mild aftertaste. Very, very nice. (0.25l draft.)
Bottle @ DeliIrium. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are fruits, malt, nuts, hops and caramel.

33cl @ Delirium. No BB date, mored than likely brewed in 2005. Appears that for br. Bouillon beers to be enjoyed you need to drink them at least 3-4 years past expiration. All the beers I ahd from them that night gushed out. Brune claire, ambrée, col fin beige. Arôme est fruité rouge, fin aigreur indiquant un certain age, levure tjrs bien vivante avec un bouquet malt faible. En bouche, étonnamment bien carbonnée malgré l’age, pointe de caramel, malt avec une pointe aigre sans pour cela reflété une infection. Aspect fruits noirs/rouges, se termine sur un malt pâle/caramel sur un choco léger et une touche de biscuité. Houblon est tjrs bien là donnant un fini amer citronné, reste très faible dans son profile scotch. Pas mauvaise, même malgré l’age. Ma note reflète plus un profile qui manque un peu la marque au niveau du style et une carbonation qui malgré les années reste trop présente.

Bottle, bought @ Delirium, Brussels. Pours clear orange amber with a big, creamy, off-white head. Nice lacings. Aroma is sweet, malty, some caramel, soft walnuts, a bit of peach and strawberry and softly oxidised. High carbonation, a bit thin mouthfeel with some soft dryness. Flavour is malty, light Belgian sugar with a soft liqourice feel to it. Fairly dry and bitter really. A bit simple, but it held up amazingly.

Brotig-süßlich-alkoholischer Duft. Etwas trockener Antrunk, herb-malzig mit der Betonung auf die übermäßig trockene Herbe. Im Anschluss lässt sich eine kurze Hopfigkeit ausmachen, dann setzt der ebenfalls trockene Malzton ein. Die fruchtige Note erliegt der Trockenheit. Test vom 20.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,8,8,9,9,9 - 8,70

Bottle, 33 cl. (bought @ Willems) Darkgolden color, with medium white head. Aroma yeast and fruity. Medium body. Taste = a bit complex fro me; little sweet, fruity, spice and bitterness. But this is not a scotch ! Good.

Bottle. This beer is misleadingly called scotch, because it has a pinkish blonde color. Grapefruit and flowers in the aroma. Grapefruit, lemon, honey and a hint of toffee in the flavor. Traubenzucker and a hint of leak. Strongly resembling the 2006 Sealux version, but rated as a different beer because of the lower ABV (7% instead of 8%) and minor differences in flavor.
On tap at the brewpub. Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit einer riesigen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch leicht bananig, hefig. Geschmack süß bananig, hefig, kaum würzig, langweilig.

Tap at the brewpub. It’s unclear golden with a creamy, white and lasting head. Until the head is almost vanished, there is a hint of sewer in the aroma, but later yeast, fruit and wheat. The sweet flavor has notes of yeast, banana, fruit, wheat and the balance is nice.

Draft at the brewpub. An unclear golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of wheat, yeast, and banana. The flavor is sweet with noets of wheat and cloves as well as lighter notes of banana and oranges, leading to a dry wheaty finish.
(On tap) Cloudy golden with an off-white head. Distinct aroma of yeast and banana. Medium body with sweet banana and yeast, some phenols also. Quite a decent Hefe. 010708
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy golden coloured. Aroma of yeast, bananas and some eggs. Light yeasty and fruity flavour. Light top medium bodied. Very high carbonation level.
On tap at the brewpub. Trübes dunkel orange goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch gering röstmalzig, Karamell, fruchtig. Geschmack mild hopfig, karamellig, röstmalzig
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy mahogany coloured. Fruity and yeasty aroma and flavour with some malty notes. Rather light flavoured. Medium bodied.
A Mes rate: Cask at JDW. Raspberry aroma. Malty with some eventual hoppy bitterness to round it off. Erm... yeah yeah.
Cask conditioned @ Giddy Bridge (JDW), Soton. Darkish golden. Floral perfumey hops on the nose which weren’t really to my taste - think pot pourri. Light malt and smooth bitterness. Not too bad.
Lemon honey flavors. A bit thin on the tongue yet over carb. Golden with decent head. Aroma yeast and lemon. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Lightly hazy, golden pear color, with a small ring of bubbles. Nose is coriander and citrus zest. Taste is the same with some grassy hop and light bready yeast. Near-medium body is smoothly carbonated and well balanced. Just a bit overdone with the additives; slightly overpowering the unique yeast flavors that are necessary to the style.
Cloudy yellow with a white foam. Aroma is lemon, citrus, coriander, bitter orange. Taste is lemony citrus, the finish is nicely yeasty but with too heavy of a bitter orange peel note.

on tap at Frieberg’s in johnson city, TN. hazy golden color with champagne-like bubbles. aroma is banana and yeasty. flavor is citrusy, bready and of some spice. finish is pretty clean with some more of the banana like flavor. its ok, but honestly not much better than something like Shock Top, which is too bad.

Name: Whistlestop Wit Date: April 18, 2009 Mode: draft Source: Brewfest, Hickory Hops Appearance: cloudy pale yellow, frothy dirty white head Aroma: spicy aroma with a touch of sweet orange Flavor: sweet orange flavor, lots of balancing spicyness adds a drying edge, light bitterness follows the spicyness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *4

Draft sample at Knoxville Brew Jam. Poured a cloudy white color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate wheat citrus aroma. Light to medium body. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met.
pours a cloudy gold with mild white fluffy head, smooth, sweet wheaty aroma. spritzy mouthfeel, wheat finish that sticks. mild and light.

Pours a cloudy light gold, with a medium white head. Smells of musty wheat and lemon citrus. Quite mild and boring aroma. Very atringent flavor, tart wheat and citrus fruits, with a touch of that dishsoap flavor I get sometimes in wheats. Not very good at all. Flawed in most every aspect. Too tart, and not enough wheat and banana flavors. Disappointing.

Draught at Main Street Cafe. Pours a cloudy, very light, off-yellow with a creamy, persistent head. The nose is very mild and bready in nature with small hints at fruit. This beer is nicely clean and superbly refreshing on a hot day. The banana presence is very natural and the spiced character is appropriately proportionate. The finish is slightly sour. Now, here’s my biggest beef with this brew: it is incredibly light. Even for this style, it’s watery. Nice thirst quencher, nice with a hamburger, but not very gratifying as a beer experience.

Very Pale yellow, almost like the juice in canned pears, and a big white head. Very fruity aroma, maybe blueberry dominating? Flavor is Apricot and blueberry, with notes of cinnamon, coriander and nutmeg. Very tasty and insanely drinkable. Down right refreshing, I’d say. At the 2007 Hickory Hops.
Tried at the horse and jockey. Waddington. Copper to amber colour with a foamy head. Very light aroma. A touch of malt and basement. Taste light and rough.
Cask @ Ship & Mitre, Liverpool. Copper with a small creamy head. More of a typical English bitter than a mild. Light malts, small to medium bitterness.
Wouln’t describe this as a mild, more like a Scottish Heavy, Taste is of sweet malts and very moreish. Appearance is dark brown

Cask, Last Plantangent, Leicester. Amber with an off white head. Aromas are nutty and earthy with weetabix malts. Leafy and peppery with woody notes. Flavours are dry biscuit malt with a surprising amount of ginger. Nettle leaf prickliness with light apple fruitiness. Dry and slightly herbal to finish. A bit thin but fine.

Cask conditioned at The Wellington, Birmingham. Amber with white head. Slightly sweet and fruity mild, easy light drinking with no challenges, but perhaps a little too thin. Pleasant with no carry through.
Cask at the Retreat, Reading. Reddish chestnut with a cream head; aroma of leafy hops and rich malts; good malty body with dry hops to finish. Simple, but very good.

Cask - The Murderers, Norwich. Pours a clear amber colour with a relatively loose, frothy off-white head. Base aromas a of a malty caramel tone with further hints of fruit and a dry hoppy character. Sweet and fruity flavour profile with a dry citrus-like bitterness. More caramel malts give it a foundation. A balance of sweetness with a bitter finishing aftertaste round it off. Body lets it down a bit, but otherwise an acceptable brew.

Cask at the Maltings, York. Amber-red with a one-finger soapy, dense off-white head from the sprinkler. Aroma is oranges, caramel, and a heavy dose of dusty hops as well as a faint bit of unrefined graininess. Taste is predominantly citrus upfront - oranges, lemon, maybe a bit of grapefruit. Light toffee malt backbone. Finish is malty and slightly sweet, with a pleasing moderately bitter aftertaste. Solid, complex in character but simple enough to enjoy. Palate is lackluster, a bit watery.
Oli yksi eilen, erittäin mukava maku. Haluaisin maistaa samankaltaisia oluita

Draft at brewpub. Pours brown with a with a thin khaki head. Leaves trace lacing in the glass. Big huge pine notes on the nose. Lots of pine on the tongue. Has a nice clean finish. Another lovely IPA from these guys. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served on-tap at the brewpub. I have been wanting to try this for almost two years now, glad to see it back on finally. A - Pours slightly hazy burnt orange with a nice one finger tall off white head leaving small trails of lace down parts of the glass. S - Smells of dulled tropical fruit, pungent citric hops and quite a bit of sugary sweetness. The sweetness begins to take over, making the other aromas almost disappear entirely. T - Starts off with a nice mix of fresh tropical fruit and sticky citric hop resin quickly giving way to a big dose of candied sugar sweetness, some pine needles and a touch of chewy malt. The sweetness really started to get to me toward the end of the glass. Finish is a mix of light hop bitterness and sticky sweetness, lingering on the palate for quite awhile after consumption. M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Pretty smooth feel with a decent amount of hop bitterness. The sweetness really started to take over the feel, making this one a touch hard to finish. O - Ehh I still like the regular IPA and Ol Frosty more than this. It kind of tastes like the IPA did when they were playing around with the recipe a few years back. Don’t get me wrong, it has some nice things going for it, but those other two are world class IPA’s. Give it a try if you can but the regular IPA is just better.

On tap at the brewpub 6/8/08: Pours a transparent copper bronze with a nicely-lacing froth of white head. Nice aroma of fresh resiny piny hops and sweet toasty dark caramel malts. Body starts fairly full and slightly sticky sweet with nice resiny bittering and flavor hops before a floral bittersweet caramel finish. A nice IPA.
Another gem from JW77. Johnathan you are just too generous my friend. Pours an amber color. Nice white head. Resin and citrus hops. Flavor is full of resin, citrus, spice and good bitterness.

On draft at Selin’s Grove. Pours a dark amber color with a thick off white head. Aroma of pine, hops, spice, honey and orange citrus. Flavor is the same as the aroma. Has a pine, malt, orange citrus, and bitterly hoppy flavour.
Draft at Selins Grove Brewpub. Pours an amber body with an off white head. Grassy grapefruit hop character with lighter pine and citrus notes. Some light hop resins and grassy finish. Nice.

On draft at the brewery. Pours a dark caramel sandy brown with a creamy medium sized beige head. Aroma of freshly squeezed orange citrus, bitter hops and light spice. Taste of orange citrus, bitter hops, honey lemon tea and light spice. Very nice.

On cask at the brewpub. A glowing super-fresh hop juice pours out of the glass. Rich, orange sweet and piney. Nice aroma! Pours darker than average. A rich copper-orange tending sienna. A frothy soap in dark khaki rides the glass all the way down. Prickly cask carbonation. Flavor is just as rich as the aroma. A cask-bodied malt marries with cascade-like hops, very spicy, orange and fresh. Delicious! The cask is a good delivery for this example. A very nice IPA.

On Handpull: aroma is big and piney with citrus spice and some biscuity malt. flavor was all hops, but in a very balanced way, this is a like a way better version of a Dogfish Head IPA. medium bodied. excellent ipa
316ml bottle. Green clear bottle. Not much aroma of flavors in this one, surprise, surprise. Some light hay and rice. No bitterness, no taste.
12oz can in a glass. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of light malts and toast and water. Flavor the same. Lighter texture. A mediocre pale lager.

This one is a little odd. It’s yellow golden and headless in the glass. The aroma is a bit alcoholic with a pretty strong grainy character. This is a bit on the sweet side and medium bodied with prickly carbonation. There is a touch of citrus from the hops but also a slight metallic character. The finish is bitter enough to match the sweetness but all-in-all this just isn’t that great.
16.06.13: Bottle 0.66 l. Złote, mocno klarowne piwo o szybko znikającej pianie i świeżym aromacie. W smaku orzeźwiające, lekko kwaskowe z fajną goryczką na finiszu.

Buy it in bottles. That is my only advice. Metallic and tasteless in cans. If you can find the large bottles you’ll be rewarded with a German Pilsner style beer. Good with food very refreshing. If this was a can review it would have got 1.8 or so.

Can purchased at the 7-11. Pretty boring pour: pale yellow with a small white head that disappears quickly. Odd finish to the aroma that reminds me of vegetables and slightly acidic? Boring flavor. About what I expected though.
Bottle, or something. Pours a weak and uninspired yellow. Aroma is sweet and floral corn with bit of weak meal in the background. Flavor is watery corn and vegetal malt. Watery mouthfeel. No more.
Draft in Taipei. Yellow, little aroma, little character, industrial. Not much to distinguish it.
canned, many thanks to marie and jakub for bringing this back with them. pale yellow, corn syrup aroma, fizzy, no hop character, extremely dull

Well, in Taiwan this is the best beer that I could find. Actually has a decent nose from the lagering. Toured the brewery, people there knew what they were doing. Not a great beer, but in Taiwan I’d drink this over anything other than the Oolong.

Pours a dark translucent brown with a semi white head. Has strong aroma of smoked wood. Has hints of some caramel or sugar and has spicy flavoring. Finishes medium bodied with a overwhelming smoke taste on the tongue.

Smells like smoked ham, Like it should. Man, I love the aroma of smoked beers. Smoke melds with mildly sweet flavors throughout - some crisp peppery flavors in the finish, bot mostly smoke and sweet. Very entertaining. Sampled at Hickory Hops 2007.
At the Seven Stars, Bristol March 2012. Pale green and slightly hazy. Plenty of medium pear fruit, a spicy, yeasty edge and gentle finish. Good.
Cask at troon beer fest 07... very very pale yellow ... smokey iodine , again odd iodine in flavour with smokey fruit finish very odd but not unpleasent
From the barrel at Catford Beer Festival, June 2006. Hazy, typical Perry colour. Relatively soft and sweetish. Some light tannin but predominantly mellow and fruity. Quite nice.

Bottled bright from bag in the box at Planet Thanet BF 2007. Pale green gold colour. Some perry vinegar aroma. Medium sweet I guess. Sweetness in mouth stops some of the other flavours coming through. Medium sweet finish with some pear juice.
Heady mix of roast, bitter chocolate, and unexpected fruitiness, leading to a dry, espresso-laced fade and lingering cherry-chocolate notes. Good beer, better pizza.

Amusing can. Oily pour, nice cascade to the head, light khaki foam. Weird aroma - maybe a little creosotic, sweet with unripe plums. The same impressions come through to the flavor - tarry, sweet, ambiguously fruity. Medium body, loose/mild carbonation. Improves markedly as it warms, in terms of balance and losing some of the off flavors. Harris Teeter, Boone.
Aroma of cocoa, nutmeg, cinnamon, and toasted malt. Taste is cocoa, malt, bacon, blackberry.
650 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with moderate head. Aromas of sulphur, light roasted malts and nutty milk chocolate. Flavors of cola and nutty chocolate. It's a porter.
Found on tap at Rathskeller in Franklin, NC. It pours an enticing black color. Is above average for the style. Decent mid fall to early winter option.
Pours a nice brown from a can. Rich chocolate, coffee aroma. Similar flavor. Good beer.

Tap at brewpub. Dark ruby colour, small steady beige head, lace. Toasted, cola candy aroma. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Light toastyness, caramel, coffee but also vegetables lurking around the corner. Watery finish. Kind of meh brewpub beer (what it is not).

12 ounce can at home. Has malty aroma with a medium size head, which is tan in color. This brew is deep brown in color. You can really taste the malt with slight hints of chocolate. Lighter/medium mouth feel and very smooth. This is an above average beer which is extremely drinkable. Cheers!
A tasty porter with lots of coffee. Pours a rich black with a medium, frothy head. Can at Thirsty Monk. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can (Feb 24, 2017 canning). Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, brown, mostly/fully diminishing. Body is dark brown to black. Aroma is moderately malty (chocolate syrup, roasted grain), with a note of vanilla. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, fizzy/lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. Very simple aroma, and kinda sweet and flabby in the mouth. Pretty dull and forgettable, but not there’s not too much wrong with it otherwise.

Pours: dark caramel with a frothy beige head that dissipates quickly Nose: Bitter hops and some sweetness. Carbonation: mild-medium Flavour: has a nice bitterness to it, definite hops and some yeast. Location: Akihabara, Tokyo

Can from Seijo Ishii. Pours a lovely deep clear amber, low off-white head, lacing. Nice nutty hoppy amber malt aroma. Pleasant crackers, low caramel sweetness in both smell and taste. More dry and earthy, decent hopping adding a smooth citrus bitterness. Medium-bodied, a little chewy but with a solid level of carbonation to carry it through. Nicely done, very drinkable.

On tap at Leffe Craft Beer & Diner, Nagano. Clear amber with a small, off-white head. Fairly malty and caramelly aroma with mild hoppy notes, and hints of spices. Medium sweet, rather mild flavours and a modest bitterness. Easy to drink and fairly enjoyable.
Fall Keyaki 2015. Deep amber with a soapy white head. Nice malty nose with some light citrus and toffee. Well-balanced with light citrus hop character. Dry and crisp finish with some bitterness.

Having just had the Aso Amber I figured now was a good time to crack open this can of Oh! La! Ho! Amber Ale I got from Taniguchi. 4.5% Much nicer looking it is a deep reddish Amber with a huge bed head of foam that lingers & leaves great lacing behind. The aroma is soft cocoa, citrus and malts. Yum. Med-light bodied with a sharp rounded carbonation that pricks your tastebuds. This US style Amber is much more my style. The taste is malty cocoa, mild toffee, graham and citrusy hop fruitiness with a light dry finish. Very nice.
Can from Nagano station. Lovely ruby pour with small off-white head. Caramel fruit and red berry aroma. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel with nice malts and berries.
From a small plastic cup at Keyaki Hiroba. Pours darker amber, small layer of foam. Aroma is very very malty, slightly thick and spicy. Tastes also malty, stuffed bread, thick, tasting nice.

Can from souvenir shop in Nagano Station. Light caramel nose, berries, tiny bit of chocolate, and yeast. Hazy reddish/amber color. and a 2cm head which dissipated immediately. Sort of nutty maltiness, minimal roast, yeast jumps up in mid palate, and small hint of bittering in finish. Thin-medium body. Less overtly malty and yeastier than many ambers. Decent nose, but flavors are not so clean.
Can in Matsumoto - shared with Mette. Clear amber - white head. Amber malts. Ok hoppy. Light sweetness. Knækbrød. Nice bitterness. Ok malty.

caramel, hay, amber, cloudy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel. Deep caramel malt nose, a bit peppery. Deep amber, attractively cloudy. Touch of pine, nice sharp malts with an appealing tingly-sweetness on the back end. Well done.

Can from the source. Pours nice clear golden, even sparkling golden. White foam on top, stays for some time. Grainy biscuity nose, light hops there but not that pronounced. Taste is simple, mainly malty and biscuity with some bitter-dry finish. Quite simple and clean golden ale, not that exciting but not bad either.

Oh! la! ho! Golden Ale 5% can at Shinshu Sake Mura. A floral bready aroma on a bright gold body. Medium bodied with a crackery light malt character and a perfumey floral hoppiness. Nice dry finish. Decent and much more flavorful than the Ki no Sato from Minami Alps I’d had right before it.
Fall Keyaki 2015. Blonde with a white head. Grassy aromas with some bread and light lemon. Crisp and bright on the palate. Dry finish.
350 ml can. Golden amber with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, wheat, light corn, malt. Tastes of citrus, wheat, floral, malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Can from souvenir shop in Nagano Station. Hay and grass aroma, light yeastiness, slightly sourish fruit. Hazy medium straw color. Crackers, flour, biscuits, cattle feed. Some sweetness gathers strength in mid palate. Thin finish. Thin body. Okay. Maybe this basic line of beers is much better on tap.

hay, grass, coffee, golden, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, light body, thin feel. Attractive, slightly hazy amber pour. Almost no head. Very grassy, field style aroma. Thin and fleeting, slightly sweet, quick and dry finish. Very easy to drink. Would be a great six-pack during a summer day. Nothing special, but enjoyably smooth.
Strong tropical aroma. Fruity malt flavor, mango, sweet finish. Pretty decent local fruity ale, maybe a bit too sweet though.

Can from Shinshu Sake Mura. Taste is light citrus, nice bitterness, grainy, floury. Aroma floral, lemon, biscuit malt. Only a few notes but remember being surprised by it as I thought it wouldn’t be so good.
Bottle from Tanakaya, Tokyo. Pale golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of malts, fruit, citrus. Flavour is fruity, citric.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a lacing, little head. Very potent lemony hop aroma. Good balance between malt and grassy hop bitterness. Full-bodied. One of my favourite golden ales of this low strength.

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: Mug Club served at a crowded bar on Valentines Day. Nitro pour, with a black/brown color, and a tan, billowy head that remained as long as there was liquid in the glass. Foamy lace followed the level of beer. Aroma was initially dry, with roasted notes, coffee, and a slight touch of vanilla. The flavor was also roasted, coffee, and a bit of dark chocolate. Not overly hopped and a very silky mouthfeel. Wish I could have stayed for more than one.

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: Entered this rating for wrong beer will rerate when tasted. Had barrel aged version not the original.

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: Served a deep brown with a mahogany glow under a wet, sudsy head. A bitter nose predicts the flavor of strong roasted grains and coffee. Palate is rather thin and watery but the flavor remains intact. Draught sample at AleFest 2007, Arlington Park Racetrack

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: On tap pours a dark brown with an off white head. Roasted aroma with a little chocolate. The sweet flavors are similar, not bad but pretty flat. Light bodied. Drinkable.

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: Nitro pull: Almost black with a thick, creamy beige head. No lacing. The aroma has some lightly roasted malt, a bit of barley, and a hint of chocolate. Ditto on the flavor but with the addition of a splash of sour milk. Actually pretty good. Rock Bottom Yorktown, Lombard, IL

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Crème Drème Stout
column5: Sampler tumbler. Creamy nitro head, thin and ecru in color. Beer is deep black, even in its sample tumbler. Taste is again creamy aided by it nitogen pour. Not overly sweet nor dry. with mildly roasted malts. I get a slight bit of alcohol heat, and a trace of banana ester.
Bottle. Cloudy orange coloured with an off white head. Fruity and spicy aroma with malty notes. Sweet fruity and malty flavour with notes of liquorice and spices. Light hoppy finish.
Hazy brown of color with a off-white head. An aroma of raspberry, cherry coke and winegums. A flavor with turf and notes of raspberry

Bottle. Pours a great-looking, clear red-like amber. Head is fizzy and quickly settles as a thin film. Aroma is very nice, very fruity. Yeast, oranges, some strawberries. Flavour is sweet, vinious, fruity. But it has a niggling aftertaste with some cardboard. In this beer it’s not that powerful a taste, but other beers have had it. Good brew.
Helles Bier mit sehr süßem Geruch nach Pfirsich und Weizen. Geschmack etwas pappig, süßlich, aber auch bitter.
Orange, trüb. Hefig-Malziger Geruch mit Pfirsich-Aromen. Leicht süßlicher Geschmack, sehr mundvoll. Alkohol gut versteckt.

Draught @ the brewpub. Pours Pours slightly hazy amber with airy white head. Clear aroma of malt and yeast, with faint notes of hops. Sweet, malty and estery flavour, with hoppy touches. Sweetish finish. well-balanced and quite unobtrusive. A decent Maibock.
A wonderful Maibock with a hint of smoked malt flavour. Modeerately bitter and full bodied. My favorite brew from this brewery

It is indeed an orange colored beer. Flavor has light cherry. Well carbonated but light overall. The flavor has sweetness that tastes like sugar, but there is some sour cherry as well. There is more flavor from the sweetness than the actual fruit. Sour finish.

Autumn Orange with White Ring. Malty and Musty Sweet tart Cherry Aroma. Carbonated Light Bodied Brew. Sweet Malt and Tart Cherry Flavor...Cherries Add to the Body of the Beer...Tart and Dry Aftertaste...Wheaty Aftertaste. Overall a Nice Simple Beer to Enjoy in the Summer...Something in the Cherry Flavor Makes it Hard to Palate This as a Session Ale, but Enjoyable Nonetheless.

About the beer: this is a light American ale infused with 100% pure cherry juice. "Hope" is brewed for a benefit we will host at the Town Hall May 1called Brew for a Cause. This is a benefit with the Peace House Foundation, a MN based nonprofit dedicated to educating and caring for Africa’s AIDS orphans. And my thoughts: Lightly hazed, apricot-ish appearance, under a solid slab of snowy foam, softly settling down. Sour nose at first, cherries chirp up, then the choir grows, and the fruity aroma builds, quite distinctive and pleasing. Taste: Cherry flavor continues this light, sour feel, all on top of a solid pale ale base, well-malance, not hoppy, really, and just enough malt. Sweet, and then sour, and ridiculously drinkable. Only drawback for me is, ...hell, it’s a charity beer, who the hell am I to quibble? It’s supposed to make a large group of people happy and still manage to have to have flavor, something they can’t pull off at a sporting event.
Light red-orange color with some foamy white head. Sour cherries on the nose. Predominant cherry flavor with a hint of bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a rich golden color with a thin but firm head. This is a very good example of style all the way around ... nice malty aroma, firm and viscous body, and a rich yet lager-ish flavor. Well done. (#6413, 11/23/2016)

On tap at Molly Malloy’s in Philly on 6/19. Faint malt aroma. Amber gold with white head. Flavors of toasted vanilla, banana, pepper, yeast, grass and hops. Booze is well hidden. Good drinkability. Nice choice.
Draft at Brew’d Pub. Clear deep golden color. Very malty, this one, and pleasantly sweet without being cloying.

22 ounce bottle. Bright, brassy gold color. Small white head. Earthy, fruity malt nose. Sweet toasted malt flavor with notes of bubblegum citrus hops. Complex flavor has notes of caramel, tropical fruit, vanilla and alcohol. Overall, a nice tasty Maibock.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass Appearance – The beer pours a crystal clear orange-amber color with a thick one finger white head that has good retention. The head fades over time to leave a lighter level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass. Smell – The nose of the beer is sweet and fruity with heavy notes of apricot, peach, and apple as well as a good showing of a sugary caramel smell. Along with these smells comes some other aromas of a bready and doughty smell along with a little bit of a hop aroma of a grassy and floral nature. Taste – The taste begins less sweet then would have been anticipated from the nose, but does contain a decent amount of caramel and a lighter fruitiness of peach and apricot. Along with these flavors is a good showing of a bready flavor. As the taste advances the caramel decreases with the bready fruity flavors getting slightly stronger and being joined by some grainy pale malt flavors. The caramel loses much intensity by the tastes end, but is replaced by a new light apple flavor that develops later in the profile. All the while some quite light hop flavors of a grassy and floral nature develop on the tongue and, with the other flavors, end up leaving a smooth, somewhat grainy, fruit sweetened, bready flavor to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the thicker and chewier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. The thicker and chewier body is fantastic for the bigger bready flavors of the brew all while the lower carbonation helps to allow for the lighter hop flavors to be sensed and to nicely complement the fruity and malty tastes of the brew. Overall – A rather tasty Maibock overall. Thick and bready with a good showing of fruit and just enough hop to keep it more balanced and rather enjoyable. Quite tasty.
Pretty nice, a long time since I’ve had a decent Maibock. Golden pour. Some sugared malt. Light sweet finish. Nice. Tap at Brew’D.

Draft at Brew’d Pub in Frederick, MD shared with Travlr, solidfunk, BeerandBlues2. BeerandBlues2. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Not much on the aroma. Tastes of citrus and wheat. Light body with a dry finish. Medium carbonation.

Tap at Brew’d Pub. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is biscuit and cracker malt, light earthy hops. Flavor is sweet malt, fruity notes, light hops and bitterness with a sweet finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
From a bomber to a tasting glass. Pours a golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of fruity lager yeast like grape skins. Almost tasted like grape juice right after my coffee. Easy drinking.
22 oz bottle. Clear rusty orange with a white head. Nose is candy apple and light grass. Medium light with a tingle. Taste is candi, apple and bubblegum. Malty but not much else.

Bottle. "Malt beverage aged in whiskey barrels." Pours slightly hazy dark amber and topped with film and a sparse ring. Aroma shows nuts, fruit, and oak. Terrific flavor. Semi-sweet with caramel, lacto, whiskey, and oak. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy-oily texture, and a mild tart finish. Very nice. Probably a bit barrel tinged, but it helps imo. Cheers Dave!

Bottle: &nbsp Carmel in color, a little dark and reddish, thin frothy off-white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Soft Whiskey and peat on the nose. &nbsp Very soft maltiness up front, mild sweetness, a little Whiskey and peat. &nbsp A little more malt than your average Irish Ale, which I like, &nbsp Decent body. &nbsp Lingering caramel like malts after the finish. &nbsp Pretty simple overall, but pretty enjoyable, and easily quaffable.

Casked at Oaks Bottom, one of the best places in town for New Old Lompoc on tap. A dark red, with a unique smoky quality to it all. A full bodied ale, that is nonetheless quiet quaffable. A little bitter but mellowed by a hearty flavor of roasted barley.

On tap at Oaks Bottom Pub. Pours dark mahogany red with a small bubbled beige head. Poured off cask at room temp. The cask made this beer very soft on the palate. The softness and warm temp allowed the malts to gain complexity. Warm toasty caramel notes blend with a light toffee and bready character. Hops were subtle, but enough to balance. Very nice session brew.

Me llegó esta semana directo desde la patagonia, y al probarla , me parecio poco interesante, poco sabrosa, algo dulce y poco lupulada. La espuma estaba muy buena, de buen apersistencia, me parece algo simple y muy aguada.

Appearance: blond straw-colored. Great head, low consistent but lasting. Aroma: malty, yeasty, aromatic citric-fruitiness. Low hoppy’s smells. Flavor: yeasty and pale malts, mainly. Citric-fruity, similar to grapefruits and lemon. Poor hoppy taste. Yeasty aftertaste. Palate: light body. Excessively carbonated.
Bottle conditioned, a very slight haze to the amber colour. Not much of an aroma, just a otuch of hops. Some zesty flavours to an otherwise unremarkable palate. OK, but nothing memorable.

in bottle, 330 ml. Amber and golden, they prevail in a set of colors, very turbid. Frothy, too much. (Too many gas attaché). Strong aroma, to flowers, probably something of citrus fruits. The body is light enough. First there comes the candy, fort, with a light bitterness. The malty does not appear. Has an abrupt and tart end.

Appearance: amber orange color, turbid. Medium head, white color and persistent. Aroma: sweet like sugar of beetroot, candy, vanilla and honey touches. Sweet-fruity like cherry and strawberry in syrup. Not hops smells. Flavor: pale malty, candy, soft yeasty; fruitiness of ripe and sweet berries, tangerines, melon and ripe peaches. Vanilla and honey touches. Softly liquory like liquor’s camomile. Slightly hoppy finish, but persistent. Aftertaste to sugar and yeasty. Palate: light body with semi-viscous texture. Low carbonation. Refreshing, but unbalanced sweetness. Like an amber ale.

in bottle, 330 ml. Has a dark amber color, turbid, with few foam and a small and lasting cord. Aromas to sweets and flowers, good enough. The body is nice. The candy in the palate is very strong and permanent, too sweet. The finish has a tenuous bitterness, just. If you like the sweet beers, try this beer.
Spicy hop malt aroma. Clear amber colour with good head and lacing. Bitter hop malt flavour with stale after-taste. Fizzy palate.

Bottle (375ml). Poured a pale yellow with a frothy white head which was mostly diminishing. Aroma was of honey, some hay and wet cardboard. Taste was a typical commercial pale larger with wet cardboard and some honey. Body was light with a watery texture and a non existent finish.

Yuck. VB. Nasty. Vile. Foul. This beer belongs in hallowed halls of GTSAFM right next to the Schoff! As soon as I poured this filth the aromas of VB jumped out and punched me in the face and I knew I was in for a treat! Smells kind of like dried corn mixed with a little sweat and vomit. The vomit part I am assuming was from my younger stupid days when I though VB was ok and drank enormous quantities that revisited me shortly thereafter. Very clear beer with a small white head that quickly disappeared and reminded me of soap scum. The flavour was slightly smokey and hangs around for far too long after swallowing (which was hard enough). Dry and watery on the palate with a fizz like soft drink, leaves the mouth feeling defiled and chalky. Avoid like the plague!
No discernable aroma at all. Poured a cheap and nasty headless stench. Worse than most of the Aust macros. What are Blue Tongue doing with this? Tastes of corn with a nasty sweetness. Dire.

Smells terrible, corny, metallic and generally offensive. Just your typical Australian lager really. On tasting it doesn’t prove to be as sweet as expected, and although there is nothing there to make it worthy of a drain pour. However, I am following the bottle’s advice and drinking it quite cold, because I’m very afraid of what would emerge at warmer temperatures. Actually, I do know because this is the second time I’ve had this beer and the other time I had it warmer (and did indeed drain-pour it)! Frankly this is nothing more than a VB clone aimed at claiming the loyalty of the parochial Hunter folk - I hope it doesn’t succeed and fades off into history.

not as bad as i expected, cardboard nose, corn flavours, slight bitterness. Very low carbonation so it is definitely aimed at Guzzler territory. What i don’t mind is that it is low on sweetness and uses restrained hopping which means that there is little to dislike. Problem is not a lot to explicitly like either.

Picked up a 6 pack of 375ml at my local Dan Murphys. Soapy corn aroma, skunky like you standard low-end Aussie ’draft’ beer. Pale gold body with some white foam. Thin bodied, corn flavours, slight hop flavour with a metallic dry finish. Unremarkable, dime-a-dozen sort of beer.

Bit cheeky of Blue Tongue to nick the "Hunter" appellation for this new lager when junior local rival Potters uses it for its range. I guess there’s no trademark on regions of origin, but I can’t see that the confusion does either party any favours. Blue Tongue positions its standard lager as a "premium" product, so this must be pitched at a lower price bracket for the local market. Certainly that’s what the cheap and old fashioned label, replete with the Australian flag, seems to indicate. It’s a fairly sorry looking lager, clear gold with a budget-sized scattering of suds. The aroma confirms that we’re in VB/Carlton Draught territory here - cardboardy malt, sweetcorn and sour uric notes. It’s thin and sweet, with strange chalky flavours, before finishing with a familiar POR metallic ring. Grippy carbonation. "Serve ice cold", it says on the label, and you’d want to because you wouldn’t want these aromas and flavours to develop any further. No worse than VB or Tooheys New but certainly no better. (330ml bottle from Liquor on Parade, Kingsford.)

Aroma; vegetables, cabbage and medicine show. Look; big deep offwhite head and clear bright golden body. Taste; boozy malted pepper spicy medical cabbage, and finish malted grainy. Feel; glued body and fizzy co². Overall; tare bull, terible. [importat flaconul de pe o piață Velmart din Chișinău]
Keserű, de meg iható és roppant vizett... A szőke változat sokkak finomabb 😀😀😀

500ml embossed bottle. Clear golden color, foamy white head that sticks, plenty of bubbles. Aroma is lightly skunked, bready, light but noticeable booze. flavor is grapey, minerally, sweet, malty, very sweet brew, some metallic. Seems pretty fresh but wow very sweet.
Caramel, hops in aroma. Yellow, clear with small white head. Toasted, caramel notes with a bit hops bitterness in the finish. Light body, high carbonation.
Dieses Bier ist mit 7% etwas stärker und sollte wohl ein Bockbier werden. Allerdings ist das nicht gelungen. Es ist einfach nur alkoholisch süß und als Sorte nicht zu erkennen.
500 ml bottle. Clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma is small sweet malts and some hops. Not a bad shade of sweetness with alcohol, malt aroma, soft intoxicating bitterness at the finish.
Bună, puțină dulceață de malț, ușoară tărie, malț din cereale proaspete, paie proaspete, ceva biscuiți.
Bottle........Gold in color with a small head. Really just a terrible beer.

Thin, somewhat harsh, grassy, and not terribly good stuff--doesn't have much of the boozy or any of the malty notes that make the style fun, though as an ISL fan i still obviously find it quaffable and am rating it on that basis. Could be stronger as well (not just for the name!) (16.9 oz bottle, supermarket, Chișinău)

Bottled at random pizza joint, Chişinau. Clear golden, small head. Fruity nose with some salty vomit. Sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Salty and fruity with peppery heat and a terrible of flavour reminiscent of vomit.
Very light in color, sparkling, weak in taste, little bit to sweet. I have drunk some worse, but many better as well.
Ein klassisches Helles, das sich durch seine hohe Drinkability auszeichnet. Nichts SPezielles, aber ein solider, brauchbarer Geschmack, der sich sehen lassen kann.

Alk. 5,2% ABV. Zwyczajny eurolager, bardzo słodowy. Na plus - wygląd, barwa przezłocista, piana z lacingiem, ładnie musuje - przecietna wielkość wysycenia. Chmielu i większych wad brak. Ta słodowość zabija dość pijalność, dlatego zaniżam oceny. Białoruś odhaczona.

Srednie piwo nie bylo az tak tragiczne zreszta nie ma co oczekiwac rewelacji po dolnej fermentacji i w dodatku w lagerze. Piana spora srednio trwala, jasna barwa, zero aromatu w smaku malo slodowe srednio gozkie.

Приятно золотой цвет, пена средняя, пузырьки мелкие, но пена долго не держится. Вкус немного сладкий с приятной горчинкой. Достаточно космополитичный сорт, подойдёт для большинства и по качеству и по вкусу.

Bottle 0,50L. Courtesy of Kita. Clear golden color with two fingers of long lasting, frothy, white head. Bready, malty, grainy aroma with peppery note. Taste starts light sweet, grainy, slightly dusty and finish light bitter and dry. Not bad for industrial lager...
Bottle. Wet malt aroma and nothing else. Beer taste shity, like water with light unpleasant bitterness. Awful

Bottle, 0.50l, courtesy of Daniel, shared with my colleagues. Aroma is papery, grainy, grassy and floral. Taste starts light sweet grainy and chalky, following is grassy and vegetably, mouthfeel is dry, while finish is mild bitter. Light body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. Just a new country tick...
Golden beer with white head. Malty, grainy in aroma. Bitterness is light. Sweet finish with a little bit of sourness. Not bad, but there is nothing special.

Bottled 500ml. -from random shop in Minsk, Belarus. Golden coloured, small white head, light grainy nose. Bready, light grainy, discreet touch of hops and some bitterness in the finish. Usual lager but overall not bad.

Color amarillo transparente con espuma media blanca de retención y residuo medios. Aroma a óxido y metal. Sabor a metal, cereal, maíz y extracto de lúpulo. Amargor medio y regusto metálico de corta duración. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonatación alta. Una Lager desastrosa, de sabor a lata y tornillos.
Clear golden color without head. Grain And sweetcorn aroma. Quite drinkable and light dry.
1l color dorada con espuma blanca, alta, irregular, media resistente. Aroma cereales, carton, metalico. Sabor- cereales, carton, metalico.Nada...

I bought this bottle at the alcampo in Sevilla. I drank it yesterday without any surprise and it was the true. Of course. that for the price don't expect a river of gold and the taste is something sad like the buldings of Sao-Paolo. You have almost no taste with three seeds of malt, a small piece of hop and a huge river like the Rhein. The color is yellow and gold, normal carbonation, thin and white foam and it is a cheap and boring nectar.

Olhão 9/7 2016. 33 cl can from Jumbo Supermarket. Produced for the Auchan retail group. Green can with lots of golden ears of corn to indicate that I am in for a malty and grainy experience. Can’t hardly wait. Pours clear pale yellow with white head and lively carbonation. Head disappears almost immediately. Aroma of sweet malts, wet cardboard and glue. Strong carbonation and watery palate. Taste is very sweet with almost no bitterness for balance. This is an almost perfect example of a bad discount beer.
Can from simply supermarket in Salou, Catalonia, Spain. Pale golden beer with small head. Aroma of cardboard and sweetcorn. Taste is sweetcorn and malts. Not too bad.
Can from Sarkynorthener Spanish trip cheers Martin; clear yellow pour white head disappears instantly, aroma has malt, taste has grass and pale malts.
Dorada limpia sin apenas burbuja y espuma blanca. Aroma a nada. Sabor metálico, es a lo que más sabe. Gas abundante. Muy floja.
From Alcampo. In Ikea’s pilsner glass. Reading CPPHTP10 Ch15. Another stinky garbage from Font Salem. Didnt expect anything else, of course.
En typisk ræv til benk - boks til munn - pant til kiosk. Traumatisk ølopplevelse i Palma, Mallorca.

column4: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Can. Nose of dark extract, molasses, and some undefined garbage stink. Medium straw, honey color. Harsh molasses initial; sweetness takes over in mid; final has a rasty bit of roughness. Thin-medium body. Too hard and harsh. Better than some low-alc brews, but a bit hard to get down. And so it goes... into the drain.

column4: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Can. "Brewry Premuim Lager". Brewed for the Japanese Doshita Corporation. Only 57 calories :-&#41 Yeah! Clear amber colour, short lasting white bubbly head. Some lemon in the aroma with grass, grains and caramel. Thin mouthfeel. Sweet caramel grainy flavour, light lemon, sweet dry grainy mild finish. A "Diet and health conscious beer"........ ?....... diet maybe.... health conscious... not.

column4: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Medium shiny white head. Yellow body with carbonation. Chemical paper waste aroma with hop notes. Taste is watery papery resiny hops. Dry paper and straw aftertaste. Absolutely useless. (0.355l can.)

Medium Amber Color with White Skin. Sweet Malty Aroma. Light Buttery Toasty Flavor..Nice but Brief Pumpkin Flavor Notes..Sweet Caramel Malt..Light Dry Malt Aftertaste. Thin Mouthfeel. Light Bodied. Not Bad for a Session Pumpkin.

CASK: Glowing Dark Orange Color with White Frothy Head. Good Hop Aroma. Sudsy Bubbles...Cascade Dry Hopped Ale...Light Mouthfeel and Body. Light Sweet Malt Propping Up Cascade Hop Flavor. Dry Hopped Aftertaste. Decent Hop Profiled Brew.

Bottle ala Bob. Light amber color with a small, but stable off-white head. Hints of cinnamon atop some wet cardboard and light malt. Light pumpkin flavors with some dry grass and mild, mild spice. Only a touch of acidity, which is a good thing based on the last few bottles from this brewery. A light flavored pumpkin spice brew.

On draught and in bottles at the Appleton brewpub location (Fox River Mall), pours a clear light amber brew with an average sized off-white head that quickly dissipates to a thin white ring and very light lacing. Aroma of golden grain malt, a touch of corn, light pumpkin, a hint of mint, and some light spice. Taste is semi-sweet, very little carbonation with flavors of light golden grain malt, pumpkin and a touch of nutmeg. Finish is slightly watery with a hint of spice and mint aftertaste that quickly disappears. The mint was interesting for a pumpkin beer.
Strong pumpkin and spice aroma. Base beer was quite weak leaving out the flavor aspect of this brew. I like flavor in my beer but this one did not have it.
Dark Orange Color witih Brown Hues. Big Pumpkin Spice Aroma. Carries Over to Flavor, But Much More Subtle..Light Wheat Aftertaste. Not a Bad Session Autumn Ale.
Cloudy Hazy Yellow Color with White Head. Belgian Yeast and Coriander Aroma. Light Hit of Pungent Flavor...Medium Carbonation and Mouthfeel. with Light Dry Finish. Ginger Was Very Hard to Detect.
Cloudy Sunset Orange Color with Off White Head. Light Citrus/Hop Aroma. Intially Wet Hopped..Then Dominantly Dry Hopped and Tangy...Lingering Citrus Notes...Decent Hop Heavy Pale Ale.

Sampled at the brewpub; bright pink with the aroma of maraconio cherries. The flavor isn’t as strong as the aroma, only vaguely there, almost like an artifically-flavored cherry candy. (#2805, 4/21/2007)

on tap-pours a tan head and black color. Aroma is dark malt-swee licorice/caramel. Taste is dark malt-sweet licorice/caramel/chocolate/coffee, cream/milk, secondary hops. Acidic. OK/mild carbonation. Had at Hickory Hopfest too, nicely done, not my style.

Draft pint at the brewpub; Pitch black and a suck-me-in warm roasty nose. Warming and robust with being overpowering . Not quite up to the "baltic porter" label, but a nice well-rounded rich porter. (#2808, 4/21/2007)
I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
still a little lighter and more one dimensional than i’d prefer, but the Hallertaus are evident, and i like that at least a little. i may even return to this one."

Poured bottle from Trader Joe’s into nucleated pint glass. A beautiful golden color with creamy white foam. Very aromatic: bread, cracked grain, faint caramel. Well-rounded taste. More body and complexity than familiar light lagers. The hops bitterness is sufficient to balance the malt sweetness, and you can smell some noble aroma hops, but I would hardly refer to this as a "hop fest." JosephsBrau Hopfest marketing misleads hops-addicted American ale drinkers, but it is nonetheless a decent German-style Pilsener.

Slight lager aroma, with a touch of floral hops. Pours a clear amber, with a nice white head. Slightly sweet start, with a bit of a bitter finish. Very light on the palate, and very drinkable. A good value for a summer drinking beer at $6 a six pack.

Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate honey, light corn, and a touch of grass. It pours a transparent gold with an inch tall white head with okay retention. The flavor starts light-moderate sweet with honey. The finish has light grass and floral hops along with a touch of lemongrass. Light-medium bodied with carbonation that is somewhat fizzy.
Pours a clear gold body with a thin but lasting white head. Very light flavors - mildly sweet and some earthy hops. Not much to this one but okay.

Clear golden pour with barely any head. Aroma of european hops and light buttery malts. Flavor is vapid, boring, very little hop flavor , corn, slight bitterness in the back of the throat. Not crisp enough for a solid pilsner. And the name Hopfest is a misnomer. Very meh.
Gold with a thick, fizzy white head. Aroma of slightly sour lagery malt and hops. Flavor is hoppy with an undercurrent of sweetness. Mild bitter hop finish. Meh. Ok.
A grainy corn aroma and a toasted grain flavor. Appearance is a clear yellow color. Would love a little more body but this is a drinkable beer nonetheless.

Bottle. Poured a large, rocky white head that didn’t want to fall away. Nice lacing. Clear, golden body. Light malt aroma with some hay and a fair amount of floral and herbal hops. Taste was about the same with some mild pear and honey flavors. The hops definitely play a prominent role in the flavor profile (without being too dominant/overpowering), which I appreciate. Light body with average/pleasant carbonation. Nice hop finish. Overall a nice German pils for the price, but the malt flavor could have been a bit cleaner for me...something about the pear and honey notes seemed off.

column1: Rock Bottom Yorktown Fire Chief Ale
column5: Had the 2014 version of this beer. Hazy reddish color. Some roasted mellowing reddish ale flavors but otherwise a bright peppy tasting beer. Moderate hop level. Quite nice. Serving: Tap
