On tap at the brewpub (05/26/09). Gold in color with a small white head. Aroma ids of malt, caramel, toffee, burnt toast and a little cat urine. Taste is of malt and grain with notes of caramel and a little hops.
on tap-pours a white head and yellow/gold color. Aroma is very sweet light malt-caramel. Taste is very sweet light malt-caramel, herbal hops, alcohol.

Draft. Pours dark straw colored with deep gold edges and off-white head. Nose is malty, hoppy, with some frutiy esters and mild honey. Tastes malty, fruity, with some tartness up front matched by a fruity ending and an overall outstanding smoothness. A good example of one of my favorite styles.

Draft @ the pub. Clear, dark gold hue. Small white head with fair retention and lace. Nose was bready and somewhat fruity, lightly grassy and spicey. Body is medium with a graininess on the palate. Lightly sweet malts balanced out by some grassy hops along with notes of grain, light bread and wort. Decently balanced finish between the malts and hops, nice bite. Not bad.

Draft at Stewarts....Good brew... Light amber in color followed by an ok head. Taste was refreshing... To me it tasted like spicy raisons. Sweet...Light hops and good malty backbone. All well balanced. Nice medium texture. Overall a good brew by Stewarts!

May 2006 - Another enjoyable brew from Stewarts. Poured clean pale color, little head and lacing. The flavor in this was really well balanced. All the sweetness of a nice fruity bock, but lighter and with a hop balance that made this a beer I could drink all night long.

Draft at the brew pub. Dark, malty aroma with hints of dark fruit. A deep brown color, not quite opaque. Decent beige head that left point lacing. Medium bodied. A light carbonation bite. Starts sweet with malt and plum and/or raisin. The finish is not quite dry. The hop is always dominated by the malt, but it is noticeable in the end. Seems to be floral hop, but it’s hard to tell with the malt and dark fruit. The alcohol was never intrusive. Seems a bit more Belgian than British. Sip rather than gulp.

10 ounce sample tasted at the brew pub. Vinous, raisiny aroma with some light buttery notes. The aroma on this is actually quite faint and not overly noticeable. Mild-moderate hazy amber body with a copper hue present. There is a small off-yellow head. Wow -- caramelly, buttery, big herbal diacetyl flavors to start. Lots of butterscotch. Correction. Tons of butterscotch. Mild vinous flavors in the middle. Light booziness to finish with a very mild hop bitterness in the end. This beer is a love/hate beer. If you do not like diacetyl, you will not like this. Asfor me, I do not mind it.

"this is one of the tastier spring selections at the Rubicon pub in Sac. Aromatic malty but balanced goodness with a nice full mouthfeel without being heavy. Earthy hops and slightly sweet malt flavor. Good stuff."

On tap @ Brix Sunset Beach. Was hoping this would actually be purple, but it’s merely amber. Smells of caramel, sugar, and fruity esters. Pear, grape, honey, and grain. Light herbal and floral hops. The flavor is sweet and sugary. Honey, grain, and caramel. Some hints of fruit, light hops, and grape. Meh.

pint at flannys 7/29/12. golden brownish color...nearly amber with a white head. aroma and flavor are very fruity....bruised apples, bubble gum, grain light brown sugar. it is on the sweeter side but finishes with a mild bitterness.6/4/6/3/13-

Draught. Arbitrary score 4/5 for Appearance, as nighttime conditions prevented correct assessment. Bit spicy nose, sweetish, clove-y. Sweetish-bitterish taste, again a yeasty-spicy finish. Good balance, but rather dull flavour. Medium carbonated, medium bodied, tad falling flat. Technically speaking one, but one very dull Maibock.

On tap at the brewpub. It pours golden with an off white head. The aroma is a little sweet and malty with some caramel and a good dose of noble hops for balance. The flavor is well balanced as well with a slightly noticeable alcohol kick. The body was full, and I really enjoyed the malt character on this one. Nice job.
Tap @ Hamilton’s Tavern. Pours a mostly clear medium amber color with a small off white head. Some roasted malts, cereal grains and a touch of hops.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream colored head. Honey and light malt aroma. Honey and malt flavor with light spice. Medium bodied. Honey and malt lingers with light spice.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours darkish amber with a white smear for head. Light caramel and mild fruit aromas. Medium body with mild carbonation. Flavor is quite caramel with a somewhat bitter fruitiness. That purple is making me think a hint of concord grape. A bit unusual. Finishes more bitter than not.
Not very bold. Flavors are muted. Not much aroma. Solid but not my favorite style.
On tap at the brewery. This copper ale poured with a thin beige head and a floral aroma. There is a strong caramel malt base with some carbonated hoppiness. It’s slightly harsh but still drinkable.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Pours dark black with lots of tan head, looks absolutely delicious, crisp aroma of bitter chocolate and nut malts but taste is dirt-forward, it overwhelms almost everything, can still taste some very bitter dark chocolate, watery mouthfeel up front, but ends up sticking and gritty on the teeth. tap at brewery.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Draft - pours brown white head - nose and taste of chocolate toast and caramel bread - light body

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Sampled on draft at the brewpub this beer poured a very dark brown color - almost black- with a medium sized soapy tan head with good lacing. The aroma was dry and roasty with some brewed coffee. The flavor was dry and roasty with brewed coffee, wood and a hint of cocoa. Long finish. Medium body and smooth. Ok.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Draft at the source. Clear dark maroon color, beige head, solid lacing. Aroma of cocoa. Taste is light bitter cocoa. OK.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: 11/20/2014. On tap at the brewery. Dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate and coffee aromas. Coffee flavors, bitter hops, chocolate flavors leading to a light bitter finish.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Dark brown-black body medium to thin light tan head, and spotty lacing. Roasted malt base and light coffee and leather and chocolate. Medium bodied gentle carbonation, light sweetness and a lingering finish.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: A smooth and firm body with a hint of nuttiness, coffee, chocolate and roasted flavor.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Cask. Pours deep, dark brown with average, creamy beige head; decent retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is chocolate malts, toffee, light coffee, light earthy hops, plums, and raisins. Flavor is roast malt forward with milk chocolate, dark fruit esters, and faint earthy hops; creamy, dry finish. Light body and low carbonation.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: Beer engine. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy light tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate and roast malt with earthy coffee notes and dark fruity esters. Flavor is dark malt dominant with medium bitterness, light hops and fruity esters with a dry finish. Medium to light body and medium carbonation.

column1: Union Barrel Works Round Boy Stout
column5: "Firm body"...hardly. This stout was thin and left my mouth wanting more. Disappointing. Just okay.
From old notes. White Ale bottle. Nose of wheat and lemon. Taste is tart lemon. Quite refreshing.

Bottled at Akkurat, Stockholm. Cloudy dark yellow, coarse lively head. Fruity bubblegum aroma. Medium bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Caramelly malt builds a mid sized body that is covered in bubblegums and estery pears. Getting a bit honeyish and sticky in the finish.

Bottle. Poured a slightly hazy, dull, straw color with a soapy white head. Oxidized wheat nose with big spice notes mostly coriander, orange zest, floral hops, and grain. Thin to medium body with a watery mouth feel and soda pop like carbonation. Flavor is dominated by wheat, and there is a good amount of honey sweetness, there are some floral hop notes as well as spicy coriander and citrus zest. Weird sort of astringent bitterness shows up near the finish. Not great.

Bottle: &nbsp Dull golden, hazy, moderate sudsy white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Pale, dull wheaty aroma, a little basement like, dank, perhaps even a bit grainy. &nbsp Rather dully wheatiness on the tongue, a little bready, backside is a little astringent. &nbsp Has a musty aspect to it. &nbsp Not bright, certainly modeled after an American Wheat as I get no clove nor banana in this one. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate, a little thick but at the same time very dull. &nbsp Pretty boring and not all that flavorful. &nbsp Not bad, but given that its nearly spring this summer release is probably over the hill. &nbsp Thanks Bob for the bottle!
One bottle. Poured a decent white head. Aroma of coriander, wheat and lemon. Medium body. Flavor of wheat, lemon and sweet malt and some spice.

03-Feb-08 (12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Slightly hazy and bright golden in color, the quarter-inch-tall white head is kept alive by dozens of streams of tightly packed bubbles making their way to the surface. Wheaty nose seems sweet and honey-like, with a floral hoppiness coming out as well. Big, wheat taste is balanced by floral hops, but the honey sweetness is terribly prominent. Bitterness is light-medium, but seems stronger because the wheat is an easy push-over. Medium in body and well-carbonated, but the sweetness of the beer along with the floral nature of the hops leaves a heavy and stale feeling on the palate and a bad aftertaste. Plenty of flavor here, which is a big plus for an American-style wheat beer, but the hop profile isn’t especially enjoyable.
Bottle from the Fresno Marriott fridge, go Dogs! Cloudy orange gold pour with minimal white froth. If the target was minimal taste and aroma with a nice finish - they hit it! Not for me.
Light coriander and strong wheat aroma. Cloudy yellow color with a small white head. Wheat beginning with a citrus middle getting tangier in the finish.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle at John’s Marketplace in Portland, Oregon. Pours a semi-hazy straw blonde brew with a thin white head that quickly dissipates to a thin ring. Aroma of crystal grain malt with wheat, some lemon zest, flowery hops and a touch of coriander. Taste is medium bodied, lightly carbonated with flavors of wheat malt, coriander a touch of black pepper and some citrus zest. Finish has a mild spice and bitter aftertaste that slowly disappears. For a year-old bottle of wheat ale, this hold up pretty good.

Pours cloudy straw colored with large carb. bubbles and a frothy white head. Pungent wheat, coriander and black pepper aroma, also lemon zest. Very crisp soda like body/carbonation. Somewhat chalky wheat flavor with lots of lemon/citrus and some coriander. Spicy black pepper finish, sweet aftertaste. The description here says "malted wheat" the bottle says "unmalted wheat" from the consistency and flavor I’d go with what the bottle says... A pretty good Belgian Wit... this shouldn’t be listed as a wheat ale...

Bottled. Brownish red, small head. Balsamic cherry aroma - actually quite pleasant. Then it hits: An all dominating flavour of chemicals and artificial sweetener. Harsh and raw wirth syrupy mellow mouthfeel and a burning chemical finish. What an utter mess.

1L flip-top glass bottle. Slightly hazy golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Bit milky, slightly sour, fruity, malty, grainy, sweetish aroma. Malty, sour, wheat, light grains in taste. Sour mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Malty aftertaste (and some banana in late late aftertaste). Feels like lager with some wheat in it. Messy.
The head is ok, the body yellow, orange and cloudy. It smells malty, dry, watery. The taste is less CO2, bit malty, dry, dry-barley, watery. 10/8/7/7/9/8

Hazy yellow with thin white head. Some lacing. Aroma.. Grainy wheat, honey, butter, malt, yeast, spices Sweetish with bit spicy low bitterness sourish finish. Its quite weird, but not unpleasant weird.. if you take one for interest. .Second for enjoying I wont take

Weird beer, colour is like drained mash, foam lasts medium, to me it tastes like mudwater with oil used in macDonalds plus some sweetness. Cause don’t have much experience with wheat ale, hope to update info some day. update: some flower hops in aroma at the beginning, carrots, then - whole ginger, licorice flavor. Pours cloudy pale amber to orange with medium white top, thin foam layer stays on. Taste - malty light sweet with weird bitter from hopping and something else. Medium body with OK thickness texture, no dry or long. This brew seems not bad made, but flavor just seems not mine.

Strange odor! Smells moldy and sweet, a little honey and butter. And then we come to the taste, it is equally bizarre, sour and grainy malt, urine, buttery caramel and I do not know what the hell more. This beer is so weird and awful that it must be tested once! I promise you have never tasted a similar wheat beer ever.
0.5 l bottle at Petalax Beer Festival 2010. Pale golden color. The aromas of apple, butter and grains. Grainy, orangey, herbal and bitter flavor. Unpleasantly soapy.

Bottle 500ml. @ Petalax Beer Festival 2010 - the 4th. edition. Clear light to medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, grainy, old malt, moderate yeasty, yeast. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20100702]
Bottled (bought from Riga) Slightly yellow color, small white head. Very grainy, yeasty, grassy aroma. Slightly yeasty, sweet bum -like, twisted and grainy flavor. Bad ...
Bottled@PBF2010. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is mild wheat, bready malts, some mild notes non-sweet sap. Flavour is toffee, fruits, some bready notes as well.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Toffee and vegetable aroma. Malty bready flavor with some spicy notes. Thin and not very weissbier-like...

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: bottle. amber with small head. generic pale ale with medium malt body and solid hops.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: A - Pours a cloudy burnt orange with 1.5 fingers of white head that sinks rapidly to form crop circles. S - Lots of caramel malt, orange and grapefruit cascade hops. T - Rich caramel malt that is full and has a candy sweetness to it. Hops start in quick and keep the malt in check by offer a clean citrusy middle to finish. Has some tartness on the back end. M- Medium lush body. Nothing fancy here. Just a great unfiltered APA with nice caramel malts and clean citrus hops to offer a refreshing and very satisfying beer. Serving type: bottle 01-28-2011

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: Poured from bottle. Murky orange with a fair amount of dissipating head. Aroma had notes of fruit and bread. Nice kick and decent bitterness, but nothing spectacular. Drinkable, but fairly banal.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: Copper color. The pine and caramel notes lingering about were quickly overridden by the bitterness, astringency and light metallic off-notes. Taxing.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: 12oz bottle 12/10/11 (Jack’s Mountain Home)-44° in Lager Glass-Pours a slightly hazy orangish amber with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, pine, and malt. Taste of the same with a bit more malt on the back end. This medium bodied brew is not bad. Goes down easy.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: Not quite the big hop aroma you’d expect. This is pretty good; quite dry in the finish. The best finish easily of all the choc beers I’ve had. and maybe the best one too.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: 12oz bottle pours a murky brown/amber with a huge khaki head. Aroma is faint fruits and caramel, hint of roasted malts. Taste has an initial acidic bitterness into some roasted malts and finishing with an astringent bitterness. Blah.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: Bottle pours a hazy orange with a thin white head. Scent is hops and bread with a fruit note. Taste is toasted malts and lightly bitter.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with hints of citrus. Fruity malty hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy finish with hints of caramel in the aftertaste.

column1: Petes Place Basement Batch Pale Ale
column4: Krebs Brewing Company / Pete's Place / Choc Beer
column5: bottle-pours lightly hazy orange with a soapy white head. nose of oxidized hops and faint grainy notes. flavors show a decent beer here if it were in better condition. big cascade notes here and finishes pretty dry with some grapefruit notes even though there is oxidization. could be very good if fresh.

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Thought I’d better these to see what all the ’fuss’ was about. Described as smelling a bit like lemon dishwashing liquid and tasting a whole lot like lemon dishwashing liquid - I just can’t disagree with that. And what makes it worse is it get’s sweeter the more you get down through the glass. Good thing wifey likes it as she’ll end up drinking 5 & 3/4 of the 6 pack!

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bright clear piss yellow colour with firm white head. Sulphurs aoma, lime citrus flaovur, all that additive, thin body and weak. Aimed at female drinkers.

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: (Bottle 33 cl) Clear, pale golden with a rough, white head. Chicory aroma. Medium body with sweet malts and brewing cereal and some sticky sweetness. Absolutely no bitterness. 120208

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle 33cl. Light golden clear body with small head. Hints of coffee in the nose. Bitter finish. Pretty boring beer.

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bland boring and unimaginative but at least it doesn’t taste like it was made by an 8yr old - as it’s siblings do....

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: I suspect this is lion ice repackaged. See my comments on lion ice. This is just plain awful. Less money on marketing more money on brewing would be appreciated. The downside of my trip to New Zealand.

column4: Lion Breweries - NZ (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bright golden, piss yellow in colour, with thick white head, sulphours aroma. Thin and weak. I see atrend here. Marketing project by ion nathan, which has gone wrong. If offered this beer run, run fast.

(Can 33 cl) Clear deep golden with a creamy, off-white head. Sweet caramel aroma. Medium body with lightly sweet caramel notes and an edge of cardboard. No bitterness. Easy to drink and easy to forget. 110208
Can 33 cl. Amber colored clear body with normal size head. A little hops in the nose. Sweet flavour and not much else to say. Easy to drink.
Can from Liquorland. Bright orange in colour, fluffy wite head, caramel aroma. sickly sweet flavour. Exposed to some hops. Thin and watery.
On tap at goldmalt tran phu. Thick creamy off white head. Malt taste. Well brewed.
Very dark brown. Low head but nice lacing. Light chocolate notes with slight notes of smoke. Thinnish body with light smoke, choc again. Ok dark lager.

Draft @ brewpub #1 (embassy row) location. Near black with tan cap. Asphalt, coal aromas and correspondingly great charcoal flavors. Smooth palate. Licorice finish but is dry and coaly throughout. Very nice.

Draught at Goldmalt 2, Hanoi. Dark brown with creamy beige head. Aroma and flavour of sweet caramel malt, toast and chocolate. Low bitterness and a slight roughness in the finish. Not as good as other locally brewed dunkels.

Draught at Goldmalt 2, Hanoi. Very dark brown, beige creamy head. Neutral aroma, Fairly sweet and very mild with light-medium body There’s some milk and a touch of licorice. Finishes lightly lactic with low bitterness. A mild and unassuming tmavý, the way many Czech women likes it.

Advertised as "dark pilsner". Nice dark chestnut colour with a full creamy head. Sweetish bread-like smell is rather faint. At first taste a drinkable, down-to-earth pilsner with medium body and soft carbonation; long malty aftertaste with a little bitter coffee at the finish. A creditable brew.

Tap. Pours a hazy red amber with a small, but staying and very creamy white head. The head reminds me of Guinness’. Mild aroma with a light malty sweetness. Flavour is surprisingly sweet and fruity. Oranges and belgian sugars and loads of caramel. No bitterness and a tad too sweet for me.

0,5l can. Pours semi-cloudy yellow/golden with white head. Vague aroma of banana, wheat, fruity. Taste is fruity, wheat, banana comes through in the finish. It's like they took a good hefeweissen and just stripped nearly all the flavour out of it. Boring.

25-06-2018; can; at home (bought somewhere in/near Voss, Norway). The looks of the beer are alright. It has the crystal clear looks a Kristallweizen is supposed to have. The color is golden yellow. On top of the beer a nice layer of soft white foam is formed. Foam retention is rather good. A nice thick soft drape is left after some time. Nicely done. The smell of the beer isn't to special. There are some sweet malt aromas, with that fullness of a Weizener. Some herbal hops are also present. All in all, there aren't a lot of aromas. Some yeasty touches are there in the distance, but not the strong fruity aromas a Weizener has. The taste of the beer also isn't to special. Malts give some sweets and hops some bitter herbal notes. I miss the fullness of the yeast and the touches of coriander and banana. Those are what makes a Weizener to me. It is a bit simple. Also not completely balanced...it is a bit to bitter-dry. The palate is so-so. Light body, rather thin texture and medium carbonation. The finish of the beer is short and contains some sweets and a hint of fruit, but it mainly is bitter. All in all, not the best beer. But it is a decent beer...it is easy drinkable and I most certainly enjoy it.
Et ganske godt øl, passer til det meste av mat. Også behagelig som tørstedrikk. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lys farge med lavt skum. Aroma av hvete og sitrus. Smaken samme. Frisk og leskende.

0.5L bottle. Pours light straw, forms a white large head. Sweet malts on the nose, some fruit. Banana. Decent soft aroma, some caramel malts and fruit. A bit too little wheat taste, a bit bland and anonymous for a wheat beer.

0,5l Bottle. Deep golden colour, small white head. Aroma is diarrhealike sweetness along with some caramel and wheat. Flavour is cooked vegetables, wheat and some caramel. Also some mild grassyness too.
Boks 0.5 L fra Kiwi Kremmergården Ålesund. Farge uklar strågul med hvitt skum. Lukt svak fuft av hvetemalt og banan. Smak en mild å lett hveteøl med smak av litt hvetemalt og banan.
Can, 0,5 l. Clear golden. Nice lasting head. Wheat and yeasty banana in tha aroma. Wheat, floral and banana in the taste. Not much taste. Watery.
How : bottle Appearance : almost clear light golden, medium white head. Aroma : fruits, floral, herbs and some banana. Palate : light body, average carbonation.

50 cl can. Dark orange, crystal clear, two-finger creamy white head, Nice lacing. Looks really delicate in the glass. Aroma is a bit sharp wheat malt, white bread crust and is slightly biscuity. Mouthfeel is medium, well carbonated and pleasantly mild. Taste is malt and fruity flavour hops, bitterness is at the low side. Beer is ok if you’re thirsty, but unfortunately it has some metallic aftertaste.
Aass Pale Ale er et kobberrødt øl med aroma av frukt og krydder. Ølet har en fyldig smak med høy fruktighet og moderat bitterhet.
0,5l can. Pours amber with off-white head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is malty, bread, caramel. It's mediocre, and I don't see how this is a pale ale.

Blik @ Nes Pä Hedmarken. Beetje hoppig beetje citrus beetje moutig. Gemiddelde bitter. Beetje fruitig licht citrus smaakje. Overall zacht van smaak. Mooi helder donker goud biertje met licht gekleurde schuimkraag die aan het glas blijft plakken. Ondanks het lage koolzuur gehalte.
Can. Aroma of dark malts, caramel. Tastes fairly sweet with light bitterness. Below average carbonation.
Et ganske godt øl, passer til det meste av mat. Også behagelig som tørstedrikk. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Generisk lukt til aass øl. Karamell. Brente toner? Ikke det beste ølet. 5/10 180114

Can 500ml (from Kirkenes) Ruby-amber colour, small white head and lace. Sweertish, berryish aroma. Light to medium-bodied. Caramel, "Dane berries", quite light bitterness. Industrial pale ale. Not hopeless but nothing to drink another time.

Boks kjøpt på Coop OBS! Aroma sitrus, humle, malt. Utseende klar rødbrun med offwhite skum. Smak karamell, sitrus, humle, malt, mulig svisker, en rund, smaksrik og fyldig øl med godt balansert bitterhet. Godt øl
Malty aroma with notes of caramel. Reddish and clear with a white head. Medium-high sweetness and light-medium bitterness. Average carbonation and a bit watery texture.

500ml can. Aroma is generic malt, hints of butterscotch, some floral notes. Copper brown, clear, medium beige head. Medium+ sweetness, medium bitter, taste is malty, some bread, hints of dried fruit, upfront bitterness without any hints of hops. Medium body, average carbonation, medium long finish with malty sweetness and a hint of bitterness. Quite boring, two dimensional.
A classic stout with a moderate alcoholic strength. A tasty easy drinking stout, a little watery in the end, but overall a nice one.
From backlog. 0,5 litre Can from Rema 1000 Bispehaugen. Black with light brown head. Roasted malts, coffee Caramel.
Boks kjøpt på Coop OBS! Aroma røsted malt, kaffe. Utseende mørk brun, nesten sort med lys beige skum. Smak røsted malt, kaffe, sjokolade, plomme. Rund og god øl med lett fylde og god balanse. Godt øl

Malty and caramel aroma with notes of chocolate. Dark without pellet. Fine short lasting white head. Medium sweetness and light-medium bitterness. A little chocolate in the after taste. Average carbonation with a medium body. Not much complexity but a fine super market stout.
Can. Black color with a large head. Light grainy and metalic aroma. Very grainy flavor. Dry, powdery like the air in a filling grain silo. Very light roast. Seems stale, despite being a fresh can.
Dark brown with tan head. Cherries, Strawberry jam, caramel and fruity coffee. Sweet, dry, crisp, and earthy finish. Overall: Lager/amber ale/stout hybrid. Interesting or identity crisis?

50 cl can. Very good looking, dark ruby to mahogany coloured beer, thin tan head, lively carbonation from the bottom. Smells like a porter, but is a bit on the light, faint side. Pleasant flavours of coffee, dark fruit(?), smoke, roasted malt. Aftertaste of dry, bitter chocolate. Reminds me more of a sweet porter or a dark mild rather than a stout. All in all, I think this is good value for money, I like it for what it is. Tip: try it with a bit of nutty milk chocolate, it’s interesting.
"Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there is no comments on this beer. Det må nevnes at denne ble kalt "Gourmet Stout" når eg kjøpte den, men tror dette må være det samme.
Zwart bier met schuim. Gedronken op terras in Skien, Noorwegen. Smaak is bitter en lichte rook. Best goed bier, mist echter net wat smaak om echt goed te zijn.
Pours dark brown with ruby reflexes. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Taste is not impressive, rather sweet, warery, a bit of coffee on finish.

On tap at mosquito, 0.4 poor me. Pale yellow color, light hazed, average white head, persistent, no lacing. Aroma of grains yeast and some grass, there .is a strange edge, maybe due to lagering with yeasts. Taste is a but flat, light body, yeasty finish, strong carbonation, maybe due to serving however.
0,5l Bügelflasche. Dunkelgelbes sanft trübes Bier, weisser Schaum. Getreidig-süsslicher Duft. Blütenhonig Antrunk. Dann Malz.
Yeasty, bad smell Complex, rough taste Sweet flavour with bitter finish Don’t think it’s good.

500 ml bottle. BB 26/11/14. Thanks kevnic2008 for this bottle! Cloudy yellow golden colour with a big foamy white head. Dry earthy and grainy malty aroma. The flavour is grassy hops, earthy dryness, grainy malt and some citrus notes. Quite nice actually.
Drunk from 0,5 litre bottle at Afri's in Pforzheim. Cloudy natural beer without too much gas. Pleasant. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlichem Schaum. Geruch malzig, hopfig, grasig. Geschmack hopfig grasig, malzig, leicht würzig.
Süßlicher, leicht herber Antrunk. Die Süße bleibt konstant, die Intensität bleibt gering. Mild bitter, zum Ende hefiger und insgesamt würziger. Herbes, hell würziges Finish. 8/10/9/9/9/10

bottle from Kaufland Pforzheim. Hazy straw yellow colour, large and very creamy white head. Fruity nose. Intensively malty, slightly sweet with a touch of tropical fruit and buttermilk. Slightly hoppy in the finish. Nice.
It tastes a bit fruity when Antrunk, but then comes through the hoppy, grainy character. O.K.

Bottle looks good, beer in the glass the same, fine turbid, nice head. Starts mild, but not washy, malty-yeasty, modest sweet-fruity. Also some nice hoppy notes without being too dry. Well balanced finish and quite drinkable. Nice!

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Bottle from Bruisin' Ales. Dark fruit and roasty notes. Bitter and a little thin.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Bottle: Poured a black with a tan head, Aroma was boozy with rich malts. Taste was sweet malts, alcohol burn, and very boozy.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: A full pint served at the brewery. Pours nearly black with a dark tan head. Sweet aroma with only a hint of alcohol; the high ABV is also very well hidden in the flavor. Some dark fruit in the taste; more in the nose. Plenty of dark roasted malt but only mid-taste on. Good sweet-bitter balance. M: medium-full body with medium, low carbonation. O: recommended (2012 notes revised and adjusted with tasting at brewery in June 2013)

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: [6645-20140816] Bottle. Mild soya sauce grains aroma. Slightly hazy, cola brown body with a quick bubbly head. Roasted bread and grains flavour has a lingering bourbony aftertaste. Medium-full body. Good. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4 (@ Campground Brewdown 2014, Millmont, PA)

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Bottle. 2010 Vintage. Pours black with a small fading head. Matured vinous aroma with lots of dark dried fruit, ashes, chocolate and mocha. Strong hard roast. Medium bodied. Slick and sippable with a late gentle warmth.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: 2014-08-16. Black body with a small tan head that fades. Aroma of dark malt is lightly vinous and bourbony. Flavour is similar with a vinous bourbon character throughout. Smooth medium bodied palate, modest carbonation. Finishes moderately bitter and alcoholic. Decent but bourbon centric. Bottle at Campground Brewdown

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: RBAG. Deep brown. Aroma is a decent coffee, some light smoke or ash. Sweet caramel, some vanilla, lots of coffee. Unfortunately, a bit of like..celery or something, but still really enjoyed this one.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Good label on the bomber, pitchy beer. Greate Aroma - hoppy, roast, molasses, sweet. Very tasty and warming. Nice roast over a medium-heavy sweetness. Tangy and viscous. Edgy coffee. Finishes with a little twang. Thanks to Lance @ Proof.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Thanks Lance! Pitch black pour with a dark brown head. Aroma of thick fudgy chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, oak raisinettes, with hints of smoke. Similar in flavor with more of a dark fruit aspect with a thinner body that falls at the back of the tongue. Solid.

column2: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
column5: Bomber at a bottle share. Pours almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and caramel. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, dark fruit, and wood. Decent.
Piwo o barwie bursztynowej i seednio niskiej pianie. Aromat slodowo karmelowy, w tle lekkie owoce. W smaku podobnie

Drank on draught at the brewery. Badly served, too cold and too fizzy. This influenced the aroma, very weak at first, and in general how much I appreciated this beer. Aroma: chestnut honey, caramel, mou Appearance: amber, clear Taste: Mainly sweet, light sourness, balancing bitterness in the end Palate: medium body, a bit astringent
A nutty and bitter ale, the colour of autumn leaves. Very drinkable, and frankly delish.
An excellent red beer, full of hoppy taste and a great bitterness that sticks around well after the last sip. A very complex red, the best of a good lot at Louisiane
A clear dark amber colored beer, with a light beige head. The aroma of sweet malts with caramel. The taste is sweet from malts and fruits like apple. Notes of caramel. The aftertaste is bittersweet.
Draught@brewpub. Clear copper-amber color, small steady creamy head. Light fruity-lemony nose. Kind of bubblegummy flavor. Light palate, gentle hopping. Clean, ok table beer, but that’s all.

Draught at the brewhouse. Clear dark amber – white head. Aroma: Malty, bread, berries, flowery hops. Aroma: Red berries, sweetness, sweet malty, chokolate, dark bread, citrus, flowery, caramel, nice hoppy.

Piwo o barwie ciemnobrazowej i niezlej bezowej pianie. W zapachu charakterystyczne nuty kawowo- czekoladowe z podbudowa slodowa. Smak niestety slaby, byc moze dlatego ze piwo podane w temperaturze bardzo niskiej a brak czasu zeby sprawdzic w wyzszej.

Draught at the brewery, badly served, too fizzy and too cold. This influenced my perceptions and rating. Aroma: chocolate, toast, caramel Appearance: brown/black color, quite clear Taste: Medium sweetness, then bitter for malts and hops, light sourness Palate: Medium body
Draft at the brewpub: black with a thin tan head, smokey and malty flavor, a touch of some coffee as well.
Not as bitter or heavy as a stout or porter, but a lovely burnt finish and surprisingly light and tasty.
Backlog Asia 2009, on tap at the brewery. Dark color, good foam. Roasted aromas Medium body & complexity. Well balanced Very Enjoyable, at least in this region
The best beer from Louisiane Brewhouse. It is not a fantastic beer, but given that you have been travelling around SE Asia and drinking lager-close-to-water, this is a really good beer.
A great dark beer with a full hoppy mouthful. Taste of bitterness, smoked roast and barley. Drank on tap in Louisiane Brewhouse

A clear dark brown colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of roasted malts notes of coffee and chocolate. The taste is gentle bitter, a bit dry, rosted malts with chocolate notes. The aftertaste of bitter hints of sweet.

Dark brown with golden-brown accents. Chocolatey aroma with light toast is almost porterish. Rich chocolatey character is soft, sweet and smooth. Nice light acidic bit at the end makes this very moreish. Might be Vietnam’s best brew.

Draft @ brewpub. Highlight of the Louisiane portfolio. Opaque dark brown, glowing mahogany with thick tan head. Clean, chocolate aroma has cola, asphalt, more chocolate, coffee, and wood. Clean, easy-going and mild carbonation. High drinkability. flavors beat the aromas with lots of mocha cake but dry, not sweet. Coal, nicely roasted coffee. Toasty and tasty. Pint after pint it gets better and better. Quaffable dry dunkel with excellent chocolate flavors. Revisiting proves this a winner.
Piwo o barwie zlota, bardzo ladnej pianie. W aromacie slodowosc, bardzo przyjemna. W smaku przelamana na finiszu delikatna goryczka. Najlepszy lager pity w Wietnamie
On tap at the brewpub. Pours slightly hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is grain, grass, hops. Taste is slightly sweet, grass, malt, grain.

Not very intense aroma even for a Pils (the beer was served very cold), a little honey, cereals and grass/herbs. The beer appears nice, pale, clear and with a nice head. Taste has a light/medium sweetness at first follow by a nice balanced bitterness in the end. Definitely too much carbonation, badly served. Medium body, a bit astringent.
Draft at the brewpub: golden amber with thin white head, nice deep grainy flavor, light maltyness in the finish.

The Louisiane bar, restaurant and micro-brewery on the beach in Nha Trang is run by an Aussie who brews German, Czech and English style beers, and does an extremely good job at them. This is the pick of the bunch – absolutely delicious, with perfect balance of bitter hops and sweetness. Faultless.
Backlog Asia 2009. Golden color, good foam. Good fruitiness & light notes of hops Mediu, body & complexity. Well balanced & good carbonation. Best Pilsener I’ve tried in this part of the world
A nice pilsener. Once again, after having travelling around SE Asia this is a nice beer.
sipping it on the beach makes it better. This crisp, clear beer has strong citrus and floral notes. Noticeable hops balance the maltiness well.
A decent beer, especially given the overall quality of blondish beers in Vietnam. A really great lighter beer for the beer, well rounded.
A clear golden colored beer with thick white head. The aroma of malts and hop bitter. The taste is dry bitter of fresh hops with some fruits like citrus. The aftertaste of hopbitter with sweets.
(Draught) Pours a clear pale yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of orange peel, green pepper, and coriander. Flavor of bubble gum, sulfur, banana, coriander, clove, and orange.
Calkiem przyjemna pszenica. Barwa jasnozolta, piana niska dosc, metne. W aromacie kwiaty, miod, slodowosc, w smaku podobnie. Brak finiszu na minus.
Draft at the brewpub: hazy straw color with thin white head, lemony notes and slightly sweet.
Their version of a German wheat-beer. Very floral and bursting with flavour.
Visited the brewpub Nov 2012. The wit stood out for me. A bit heavy on the orange and coriander. Very refreshing on a hot vietnam afternoon.
Backlog Asia 2009, on tap at the brewery. Pale golden color, good foam. Aromas of fruits, citrus & coriander. Medium body & complexity. Very enjoyable
Not really a favourite of my. Was heavy in taste of perfume. Ok I guess, but nothing more.

200ml sample taster. Decent perfumy aroma with sweetish notes of bubblegum, cloudy appearance. Soft refreshing flavours with a touch of carbonic bite initially with an overall thin mouthfeel. This one finishes well with a touch of sourness.
A very tasty drink. The coriander is evident among the hoppy aftertaste. The aroma fills your nostrils as you swallow, a great sensation.
A clear yellow colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of sweets, with spices like coriander. The taste of sweet fruits with spices like coriander. The aftertaste is dry some fruity sweet.
Cask at St. Albans Beer Festival 2017. Strong nose of ginger. Very soft palate. Flavour isn’t too strong, but reasonably sweet.

Third, cask in fine condition at The Heart of Northumberland, Hexham. A misty late straw coloured body, crocheted lacing from a transparent layer. Promising aroma of ripe citrus. Flavoured with grain and herbal hops. Rounded, light bittersweet finish. Easy to drink. Nice. (08.02.2019).
Gyldenbrun. Lavt tett skum. Tynn teppelacing. God nøttearoma. Smaken mere nøtter med innslag av blomster. Antydning til gress i avslutningen.
Polypin at a friends stag-do. Thin and watery, not particularly inspiring, by far the weakest out of the 4 Allendales we had.
cask oro limpida quasi niente schiuma lieve nota maltata erbacea fine citrico siscreta secchezza amaro medio
Cask, amber-gold with a loose head and an odd nose with touches of OJ and card. Body is a bit papery and thin too.

Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm. Almost clear golden. Rich aroma of hay and citrus. Dry with light-medium body and crisp, well rounded mouthfeel. Bready with elderflowers. Long bitter finish. Pleasant and moreish.

21/7/2018. Cask at the Heart of Northumberland, Hexham. Pours clear very pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, hops, malt, grass, and light tropical fruits. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy drinking, decent golden ale.
A nice curry quencher. easy drinking smooth maltiness small bitter finish bottle at home.

Shared 500 ml bottle at Tau Slipp. ABV is 4%. Golden colour, white head. Moderate aroma, a hint of citrus and cornflakes. Light bodied and refreshing, but a bit boring. Hints of citrus, cornflakes and grain. Allendale can do better than this.
Draft at Stewarts. Poured a golden color with small to no head. Aroma was jalapeno. taste was spicy, with light hop taste. Just an ok brew. Nothing special

Draft at stewarts. Light golden color, small head. It was garnished with a jalapeno pepper. Aroma was a nice spicyness to it. Texture was light... Taste made my lips tingle just a little bit. Really didnt have much taste besides a light spiceyness. Overall a unique beer that I am glad I tried but nothing worth seeking out.

Poured a dark golden color with a small, white head that left no lacing on the glass. Aroma of honey, malts, toffee, vegetal, and light toasted dough. Taste of buttercream, honey, toffee, bread, and citrus, light spice from the peppers, and a long, spicy finish.
Rating from 2005. Getreidiges, etwas herb-laffes Pils. Sehr süffig mit ganz leichter Süße. Etwas muffig-herb, aber nicht schlecht. --> 10
Yellow with a small white head. Weak aroma of herbal hops. Sweet and malty flavour with a little DMS.

Bottle, courtesy of papsoe. It pours a clear, almost golden body under a minimal white head. Grassy, flowery aroma leaving the malt in the background. The flavor is much the same, but with more emphasis on the malt, giving the beer a grainy impression. Some bitterness, especially in the very end. Medium body. Sure a drinkable beer, but too ordinary to raise any eyebrows. (080823)
(Bottle 50 cl) Clear golden with a small white head. Clean and malty aroma. Medium-bodied with a clean malt base and a dry and hoppy finish. Classic German. 230808
The bottle looks simple but good, the beer in the glass is okay. Starts modest sourish, a little bit dry. The finish is hard and metallically, but the beer is still drinkable. Average!
Bottle. Clear thin golden colour. Grainy bit metallic aroma. Mild grainy and bitter flavour. Not a Bohemian Pilsener.

TFODRBSG08 Courtesy of Papsoe. The color is light golden and the head is OK. The aroma has a light sweetness and notes of grain and straw. The flavour has sweetness (a bit too much), notes of grain, malt and straw. It’s watery and boring.
Bottle at Ulfborg RB tasting. Thanks papsoe! A pale yellow beer with a small white head. Hayish aroma with malty notes. Slightly hopped. Flavour is malty and bitter with a soft body.
50cl bottle. Pours pale piss yellow with a off white head. Hay, corn & grass. Dry & sweet corn. Watery.

Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg, 2008. [thank you, papsoe] Pours pale yellow with little floaties. A small, frothy, off-white, film head. Aroma is sweet, light yeast. High carbonation and a little thin. Sweet, brewing cereal with loads of stickiness. Certainly not my thing.

Date: 02/10/2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, Extreme Beer Appearance: clear dark gold, scant head, Aroma: sweet caramel malt aroma with just a hint of alcohol, Flavor: hot buttered caramel and vanilla flavor, lots of sweetness, light bitterness, Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.3/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: **+/4
Growler. Pours medium to light colored amber. Sweet malt aromaq. Sweet malt taste with nice rye presence. Sweet malts finish nicely on the palate. Decent

AC Beerfest-on tap-pours a tan head and amber color. Aroma is balanced sweet citrus hops, medium malt. Taste is sweet citrus hops, medium malt, toasty. Doesn’t come through as quite balanced. OK/mild carbonation.

Pours a honey gold with a thin layer of foam but no real head to speak of. Sweet malt aroma, no honey, though. Definitely honey in the taste. Under-attenuated. Thin finish, no hops to speak of. Thin watery body, good carbonation. This was lacking much too much to be enjoyable. My notes say "missing beerness".

@GCBF-on tap-pours a white head that bubbles and hazy gold color. Aroma is honey first then citrus. Taste is honey first then citrus/some pine hops – bitter, secondary malt. OK effervescence. OK, but doesn’t seem to quite balance.
Dark straw, hazy. Spicy character with graham cracker maltiness and toast. Not much to it, really. About as standard as it gets, but then it is called "Honey Pale Ale".

(Draught) Talked with the brewmaster today, Ted, who said that they put premium Hallertau Hersbrucker hops in this ale. It did give a grassy flavour and nose to a fairly muted Pale Ale. The head was a creamy white thin top above the clear, medium amber, low carbonated body. The taste has a slight bitterness and very, very faint honey touch. Fizzy caarbonation and light hop bitterness round out the palate into the finish. Refreshing in its subtlety.

C&C 750 mL bottle, bought on clearance quite some time ago from Whole Foods Market, Glen Allen, VA. Best by 05/09. Opened with a highly assertive pop but didn’t gush. Pours a clear dark amber color with small floating particles. Large tan head with decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of dark malts, chocolate, coconut, bread, caramel and spice. The taste is bready and caramelly with chocolate, spice and some nutty notes. Medium-full bodied. Decent beer.

(33cl bottle) Large beige head atop hazy dark brown body, Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, bread, some raisin, light spice. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some raisin, bread, light vinous. Light-medium body.
I really enjoyed this beer, very easy to drink and nice after taste. Saving my last bottle so I can collect the yeast for my homebrew. Can’t wait.

Beer pour dark and slightly thicker then I expected. But, although it looked like a stout, the flavor was surprisingly light and easy-drinking. The finish had no outstanding overtones, but was quite tasty all the way down. Although French brewed, this beer was very un-French. Enjoy, cheers.

Tap @ GI Clybourn (from notes). Pours a clear deep dark amber color with a small off white head. The aroma had a big smokiness, with light (or buried) fruits, wood, and malts. The flavor is the same with the smoiness dominating everything else. Some fruit and malts are there, but in the background.
Strong smokey aroma. Deep amber color. Flavor is a bit sour and smokey. It’s too smokey for me.

Growler, thanks to WeeHeavySd for sharing! Pours a deep dark amber-red with a small off-white head. Huge smoky aroma, of meat, burnt malt, wood. Taste is rich and smoky, with lots of meat and wood. Lingering big smoke. Interesting, but a little too smoky for me.

On tap at GABF 2009. Clear deep reddish-brown color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is smoked meat, caramel malt, and some roast. Flavor is caramel and roasted malt along with a great smoked ham flavor and some pepper. Body is medium and carbonation is medium-high. Very solid smoked beer overall.

Near brown body with hints of ruby. Smallish head of biggish off-white bubbles. Smoked meat aromas. The kids guessed both bacon and ham. There are hints of malt and light fruit in the background. Touches of charred wood. Flavors start with a touch of caramel in the start that lead to smoked meat, peat and hint of iodine. Finish is malty and fairly sweet with a bit of syrup.
Poured brown. Nose is big smoked grains, some roast, mild sweetness, wood, bacon. Flavor is salty, smokey, toasty malt, charred grains, meat. Very nice smoked beer.

Pours a deep brown with a beige head. Smoky and roasted malt aroma. Flavor is just like the aroma, but man this is full of smoke and wood. Way too smoky for me. I liked the Bock malt profile, so if perhaps they just tone down the smoke about 50%, this would be excellent. I think the smokey peat and char just dominate the beer too much. I poured this out

Draft at Clybourn. Poured a clear dark orange-brown color. with an off white head. Lots of campfire smoke, smoked bacon, and leather in the nose. Medium bodied and a little salty. The flavors followed the nose with plenty of burnt stick, smoked bacon/ham, and a hint of delicate toffee. A bit too smoky for me to enjoy any significant quantity (i.e. a pint), but interesting.

Sampled during Deliriumfest’s Graduation tasting in Maplewood, MN and shared by EddieB23. From a 64-oz growler pours a brownish amber colored brew with a thin off-white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of smoked bacon, beef jerky, roasted dark malt, and caramel. Taste is full bodied, light carbonated with flavors of pork jerky, roasted dark malt, liquid smoke, and a touch of roasted nuts. Finish continues the pork jerky flavor with a mild smoked dark malt aftertaste.

On tap at the Clybourne location. Consumed with a Cuban sandwich, which I highly recommend as a combination. Pours a dark mahogony color with a trim tan head. Smells amazing -- just like brisket. Tastes of tomato paste, pepper, smoke, and barley. Good stuff.
Worked for the summer grill. Pretty watery and is not itself alone but must be drunk with food.
Can. Pale golden colour with a small quickly vanishing head. Weak fruity malt aroma. Thin. Slightly sweet, weak malt flavour.

0,5 l. can from ICA. One of two "beer" options around. Light golden colour with a small white head. Weak and grainy aroma with notes of corn, hay and light rice. Skunky and somewhat sweet taste. Very light body, with a thin, watery texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes with a note of still lake water. Bad, really bad.
Can 0,5l. Tastes like cardboard, smells like cardboard and there’s not that much alcohol, so why bother.
22.08.2010, 0,5l Can. Pale yellow colour with white head. No aroma. No taste. No bitterness. Poor beer with almost nothing about it. When its icecold it is just as refreshing as a glas of water.

500 ml can. Sparkling rich golden colour. Small off-white head. Rounded malty aroma with some diacetyl. Floral hops. Crisp hoppy carbonation bite cuts through the oilyness. A little lacking in the last half, but overall a decent low alcohol lager. More flavour than the average.

Smallish white head. Yellow body with light carbonation. Papery mealy apple aroma with buttery notes. Dry mealy apple taste with papery corn notes. Mid-to-thin body. Watery mouthfeel. Dry chalky grassy papery aftertaste. Decent, but boring. &#400.5l can, Maxi-Mat, Charlottenberg.&#41

Can from Maxi Mat, Charlottenberg. Good-looking white foamy head with short duration. Shining, yellow/gold colored body. Moderate aroma of doughy malts and cardboardy hops. Fairly dry and grainy malt body, backed by some stale, almost harsh bittering hops. Light, high carbonated body. Fizzy mouthfeel. A faint bitterness in a short, sweetish ending.

(Canned) Straw colour with brief, white head. Grainy, malty nose with grain, flour, hay and hints of boiled vegetables. Grainy, slightly malty taste with sweet malt as the main feature. Hints of grain, flour and hay as well. No evidence of hops. Thin body, sweet and fairly chemical. Unnecessary beer.
Can 0,5l. Pale golden colored. Looks like dirty water. No head. Faint metallic aroma. Some sweet malty flavor. Too carbonated. Water is a better drinking option.

Found in the fridge probably from Lidl. Nose is white wine, some alcohol, some rice. Palate is faint rice, some grapes, wood, alcohol finish. Leaves a weird aftertaste. Not very pleasant or Drinkable.

300ml bottle from Lidl, Darlington. Pours clear with no head, aroma of rice, hint of melon, boozy. Taste is sweetish, with rice, toffee & caramel notes and warming grassy alcohol. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, drying warm finish. Quite OK.

Bottle @ Home, courtesy of Henriksoegaard. Pours clear almost waterlike, just a slight peachcolored note. Aroma of rice, cooked vegetables, alcohol. Flavor is rice, rather sweet, alcohol. Thin body, but still leaving heavy lacing on the glas. 301212
Downed three bottles at Chez Oki, in Brussels. Clear musty body with no head. Nose is rice, of course, sweet and alcy. Taste also sweet and very nice to drink. Warms in the finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle 720ml. @ [ T.S.H.R.B.G.S.C.S.M.T (The Second Handrup RateBeer Gathering Special Cider Sake Mead Tasting) - Ebeltoft ]. Clear crystial clear water colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate rice, almond, alcohol. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, sharp, alcohol, rice, rice boiling water. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is sharp alcoholic. [20120414]
Bottle. Clear colour. Some week almond aroma. Light marcipan/almond flavor. Average finish. Oily palate. not a good sake but still an ok futsu.
Bottle. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almonde and alcohol. Flavour is rice, almonde, meidum sweet with notes of alcohol.
Clear, white, no head. Aroma of fatty rice, sweet and plastics. Moderate to heavy sweet flavor, bad rice, light acidic finish. Syrupy texture. Flat.
Clear as water. Aroma is sweet, cooked rice and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish with burning alcohol. Watery. 140412
light sour rice,watery color,light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, light dry finish.

Draught @ Cambridge House: This one pours an almost clear orangish amber color. There was a small off white head that left some lacing. The aroma was a touch milder than I expected. There was some malt sweetness, as well a a touch of a sour fruitiness. The taste is incredible smooth and well balanced. There is a malt and hop presence, but they blend well for an excellent flavor There is also a hint of sour fruitiness to the beer, and also a hint of spice. Very Nice!
Can. Pale+ colour, minimal white head. No detectable aroma, sweet taste with almost no bitterness, not a favourite.

33 cl can. Clear golden color. Fast disappering white head. Aroma is malt, but not much. Flavor is worse; strange sweetness and unpleasnt bitterness. Not good. A waste of time and money, a waste of can, a waste of brewery tanks. Shame on Hansa!

Can 0,33l. Good grief: Recommended temperature 0 deg! (Had it at around 6 deg). Pale watery color. An OK white creamy head. Malty aroma. Sweet malty flavor with a touch of bitterness. Dull, dull, dull.

Can, 4.7%. Served eisbocked at Papsø’s. Hazy pale yellow colour, small white head. Grainy flavour, seems clean. Could have been a lot worse. Its frozen state probably does it well, separating some of the water.
Pale yellow of color with a light white head. An aroma of corn, grain - no hops. A flavor of corn, grain and notes of hops in the finish.

Can: Clear sparkling yellow/crystal colour, with a white flat head. Aroma is grainy, sweet,citric,malty, with a thin hopy nose. Flavor was aømost the same, werry sparkling mouth feeling, and watery. Thin body, short sparkling/sweet finish.

(Can 33 cl) Courtesy of yngwie. Cloudy golden with a white head. Very neutral aroma - a whiff of malt. Medium body, rather sweet and clean malts. Perhaps a bit stronger than intended as I chilled this a bit too much...sorta making an ice pale lager. No real bitterness. 180807

330 ml can. Pale golden. Crystal clear. Tall coarse white head. Neutral grainy aroma. Subdued hops. Crisp malty flavours balanced by a relatively small amount of hops. Overall very neutral in all respects. There’s nothing wrong with the beer other than it being utterly boring, serving no other purpose than being a thirst quencher.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with huge white head. Grainy nose. Thick mouthfeel as served just above 0 degrees celcius. Grainy flavour, slight bitter. Finish is quite grainy too. Heavy flavoured, but sadly one-dimensional. I had the chance to taste something from the remaining content of the can as Hildigöltur forced me to try some, obviously the melted ice was even more watery and bad. The rating covers the initial sample.
Canned. Very cold. Actually, I could not get it out of the can. After a bit of warming it turned to liquid. Golden coloured. Extremely watery.

column1: Kokuryu Shuzo (Black Dragon) Yu-gao (Evening Face) Sake
column5: Pours extremely clear with some rice and flowers, and alcohol in the nose. Very smooth taste, sweet and floral. Finishes with a warm alcohol taste.

column1: Kokuryu Shuzo (Black Dragon) Yu-gao (Evening Face) Sake
column5: This is a Junmai-Ginjo! Bottle. Pours a clear colour. Aroma of bit sweet rice and alcohol. Flavour has a soft sweetness, rice and a little bitterness. Thank you Tori!
Van tap bij de brouwerij in Gramsbergen. Hoppig, citrus, bitter. Lekker. (3-2013).

Draft sample at Pint Meibockfestival 2016 Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 17.04.2016. Taste with Jelena and Zlotta. Pour it hazy amber color with medium white head. Aroma caramel ice cream, really strange. Taste starts with nice hoppy bitterness, caramel on the back, earthy, rusty but just a pinch. Not so sweet at the end, nice.

Sampled from tap at Meibockfestival Amsterdam 2016. Clear golden yellow with a tan to white head. Sweetish-malty, grainy aroma of caramel, honey, straw and grains. Sweetish-malty, grainy taste of caramel, honey, straw and grains, followed by a short, slightly bitter, grainy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Okay.

Tap at Lentebierfestival. Slightly hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, dusty tip of the tongue, sweet sugar syruppy, vegetables, sand. Over medium sweet, sandy bitter finish. Medium body, sugary mouthfeel. Meh..

Tap from Rootz stand at Grote Markt festival. Hazy golden with big white head. Sweet grains, honey, cardboard, hay, bitter green leaves. Medium sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with a bit oily feel.

15 cl at Bierfestival Groningen 2016. Pours slightly hazy golden with medium head. Aroma: hay, citrus, malts. Taste: medium sweetness with moderate bitterness. Notes of malt, grapefruit and hopresin. Palate: Body is medium, texture is oily and the carbonation is average.
From trade with fonefan, many thanks! 30cl bottle. Pours hazy dark golden with a big white head. Aroma of grain, pale malt, dry fruits. Taste is very floral, grainy, pale malt, bitter floral hops.
Ik proef eigenlijk weinig verschil met de Mommeriete Blond van net. Zelfde typische smaakje wat de bieren van Maallust ook hebben. Hou er wel van. Deze ziet er wel beter uit, maar kraagje.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass: Good medium sized white foamy head on top of a hazy orange colored beer. Aromas of hay, malts, fruits like tangerine, some apricot and grapes and some flowers. Flavours of herbs, fruits, bitters, hay, light dry, light sweet, light hoppy, growing bitters and some grass. Aftertaste is a bitter mix of herbs, some fruit and a hint of hops. Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than medium bodied and a creamy texture. Good aroma, strong bitter flavours, good texture and mouthfeel. Nice beer.

33cl bottle Appearance:slightly hazy medium amber, frothy off white head of 2 fingers, light lacing. Aroma: caramel malt, yeast and light citrus hops Taste: grainy malts some spices and a bit of yeast. before the alcohol shows in the dry and bitter hoppy finish. Ok bitter aftertaste. medium body+ carbonation. For some reason something seems missing and on a few points it’s a bit non refined.. Not bad,,but also not great.

On tap at the brewpub. I like this style’s sass and spiciness, of which this was an over-reach of skill and not a great rep of the style. Reddish colour, overcarbonated and off taste. More maltiness than anything else.

Pours a cloudy turbid coppery brown with a thick fluffy beige head which fades to a film. Aroma is dirty and yeasty, doughy, thick bready malts, light caramel, and some earthy spice and hops. Doughy slightly dirty and earthy flavor with some spice, smooth light sweet malts, herbal, and slightly bitter. Dirty and messy but still pretty smooth, and kind of reminded me of a biere de garde I made a few years ago. Somehow this started to taste even better with some food.
Pours translucent, ruby red-amber with a one-finger off-white head. Tastes of ample malt & hops with mild to moderate bitterness. It’s slightly sweet upfront with a medium body.
Pours a reddish brown. Sweet caramel/roasty aroma. Roast malt/chocolate flavor with a touch of fruit and great hops.
Very much like this beer. You don’t get the feeling of a true doppelbock, but you get a nice combination of a good doppelbock and some good hops. I approve.

Bottle to shaker glass, pours hazy mahogany-red. Two plus finger billowy tan head. Nice lacing and awesome retention. Aroma of roast and nuts. Taste is very sweet but generous hops balances this beer nicely. Full bodied, lively carbonation, slick mouth feel. Finishes bittersweet. Tasting note of caramel, biscuit, roast, pine, tree nuts, herbs and sour cherry. This is pretty good!
Smooth is correct. Fairly tasty & a good pour. It’s decent & goes down easy at 7%. Good.
Draft. Deep clear mahogany color, creamy tan head. Aroma is nutty, malty, earthy. Taste is rich malty brown bread, lightly toasted. Nice mouthfeel. Delicious.
Dark, clear brown. Thick and creamy. Little scent. Coffee, toffee flavors. Some hop in the background. Thick, white head that sticks around.
Probably my favorite doppelbock. Has all the great characteristics, but with a sharp ipa profile that works really well. This one opens my eyes.

Bottle: If every doppelbock tasted like this, I would be all over them all the time. Clear brown color with a frothy off-white head. Sweet aroma of malts mixed with hops - interesting. Love the aroma. Flavor is hoppy grains with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Thin body.

Impeccably cloudy, the color of prune juice. Layer of slush on top. Looks like a chunky barleywine. Glows only slightly in front of the light. Aroma is supremely sugary malts: definitely closer to a barleywine aroma than a doppelbock even. The piney hops are definitely there, floating above the malts as an accent. Finished wood and resins. Light oak. Flavor is sugary malts, more resinous hops. Spicy finished wood. Basically everything in the aroma matches in the flavor. Has a taste of powdered Lipton iced tea. Feels rough and grainy; not quite a choker but a slow sipper. This is a very good beer. Although the prices I’ve seen them charging for a six pack is outrageous, it’s a damned fine beer.

(draught at the brewpub) I heard the same tale - they had intended to make a Vienna lager, but used an ale yeast by mistake. Stuff happens. Nice amber color with eggshell head. Malt aroma. Flavor was biscuit malt, some hops, some spice. Interesting.

On tap at the brewpub. This was supposed to be an organic Vienna, but when ale yeast is used instead of lager yeast you get an amber ale instead. Pours clear amber with a dense white head. The aroma has grainy caramel malt and minor grassy hoppiness. Medium / light body that’s grainy and crisp with lots of sharp tight carbonation. The flavor starts with grainy malt and some astringency along with a peppery spice. The finish has more spice and some bitterness. A fair brew.

Tasted 9/22/08. 12oz bottle. Thanks Keir. Clear with a golden hue. Moldy off-white head. Mild nose with grapefruit citrus notes. Medium bodied with crisp malts, but the floral Cascade hop dominates. Crisp hop palate. Solid. Really nice and highly drinkable plae ale.
I really like this beer. Pours a golden brown and has a pale white head. I’ve had this beer three times and each time it gets better. Deffinately worth trying.

Semi hazy amber with a quickly dissipating white head that laces a little as it fades. Aroma of floral and citrus hops, yeast, cereal with some vegetal properties. Body is effervescent with citrus and caramel leading up to a medium bitter finish that has some sweetness to it. The hop character on the finish isn’t very well defined… Bargain bin pale ale.

Coppery brown color with a small but firm head. Herbal and citrus bitterness in the aroma along with a hint of grain and malt. Flavor is a light hit of tart citrus with a cereal malt finish. It’s a little lighter than most APA’s but still a very drinkable beer. Nice to see City Brewery branching out a bit.
Herbal, leafy, citrusy hop aromas. Leafy bitterness, coppery metallic edge. Simple and drinkable.

Picked this up at a local shop because it was a bit different and very cheap. Pours an copper color with a decent head but nothing to rave about. The scent is citrus mixed with cheap beer/malt liquor. The taste matches the smell pretty well. The flavor of this beer is pretty much Old Style with grapefruit/lemon flavoring. Did not care for it too much.
Quite a nice one, dont mind it at all, love the simplicity of it, nothing special ar extra, easy to drink fun beer, doesnt feel too strong or too light, just right, mild bitter finish

12oz bottle - Pours a nice honey color with medium head with nice lacing on glass as I drank. Very nice floral hop aroma. Taste is light malt with very little taste on palate with a light hop finish. A decent brew but not a whole lot going on in the taste area. Tastes similar to a homebrew kit.
Not one of my favorite pale ales. Had a decent hop character but not much else. I agree with Haslinger. Drinkable but nothing special.
Pours clear with a minimal head. Nothing special. A typical pale ale. Drinkable but not notable.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Picked this one up at The Coffee Grounds, it is their official beer brewed with their own coffee by Sand Creek. Pours a dark brown bordering on black with a creamy white/tan head that doesn’t leave any lacing as it recedes. This one has that coffeehouse scent, more so than a lot of coffee beers. The smell is predominantly coffee. The flavor is also heavy on coffee, it has the classic oatmeal stout mouthfeel as well. There is also some chocolate and sugar thrown in the mix for good measure. It was a surprisingly good beer. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 08-24-2010 02:36:41

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Thank you to goryshkewych for this extra! Black pour with a lively tan froth. The aroma is very lactic and sweet- milk chocolate, mocha, oat sugars, and cream pervade the nose. The flavor is much the same- quite sweet, lactic and full flavored with loads of coffee. The palate, unfortunately, is quite thin. Still delightful though..

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Thanks to Tom for this rare bottle. Pours dark black with a two-finger tan head that stayed. Aromas of coffee and milk chocolate. Medium body with smooth, creamy carbonation. Flavor is coffee and bitter milk chocolate. It’s bitter, but can’t tell whether it’s coffee bitter or hop bitter. Finishes coffee and chocolate. Maybe it’s more dark chocolate than milk. Makes me want more.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: 12 ounce bottle courtesy of BDR. Pours a dark chocolate brown with a small head. Low head retention and good lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate, bitter coffee and coconut. Taste is coffee and powdered cocoa. Slight vegetal hop notes. Full bodied.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: 12oz from I believe Jimbowood. Pours black with a thin tan head. Nose is sweet with coffee notes. Taste is nicely sweet and full of coffee. Not bad, not amazing.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Bottle. Glad to try this rarity; thank you to the trader who sent it to me. Pours dark as expected with a shy tan head. Smoky, ashy aroma and a flavor to match (wet french roast grouds!); my wife describes it as drinking a cigarette and there’s more truth to that than would be ideal. The flavor and mouthfeel alike are otherwise on the thin side as well. Some acidity, little sweetness beyond a sugar-in-the-milk superficiality. Not awful by any stretch, but not exceptional either.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Bottle... VBWT2008... Pours dark and sits black in my glass with a small, creamy, lightly tanned head. Great retention. Big chocolate-milk with fractions of coffee and caramel in the nose. Barely medium-bodied and watery with medium carbonation. Sweetness and bitterness are evenly matched with a whisper of acidity thrown into the fusion. Finishes crisp and well-roasted. CaptainCougar supplied the bottle!

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Courtesy hopscotch. Pours black with a smaller, creamy, light brown head. Smells of fresh coffee grounds, syrupy malts, light chocolate, and mild roast. The flavor is mostly coffee with a big malt presence. The body is a little watery for what it looks like. Very creamy texture, the finish is lightly bitter, with a big dose of the coffee. Smells better than it tastes because of its thin body, but still not a bad overall brew.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Bottle from CaptainCougar on 10/28/07. Big head of medium bubbles on initial pour despite a gentle pour and very cold beer. Settles over 10 minutes to a dense creamy small bubble layer on the surface. Can’t help but wonder if they are trying imitate nitrogenization. Whatever it looks pretty good. Aroma is super chocolatey, but not sweet. A hint of roast. Flavor is decent, again more chocolate, but way to dry for my tastes.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Pours to a black-brown body with a lasting tan head. The aroma is heavily chocolate and oatmeal with some coffee. The flavor is deep chocolate, black malt, and coffee. Acetic coffee palate. Creamy oatmeal.
bad beer I prefer beers between 6° and 7° also too much sugar, now I tasted the Caulier, I can’t stop!!

Bottle in Ha Long Bay - Cat Ba City. Clear yellow - white head. Aroma: Light white bread, egg, light straw. Taste: Smooth feeling, light bitterness, grape, sone straw notes. Finish: A bit like biting the white part of a citrus cest.

On tap @ Dry Dock poured a clear copper with a minimal off white head. Aromas of carmel and pine. Palate was medium bodied smooth and slightly dry. Flavors of carmel, pine and light toffee with a dry bitter finish.

tap. this is an all summit ipa i believe. nice yellow tan color with a lasting head. floral aroma with some sweet hints. sweeter flavor than i expected, a burnt ivy hop taste( i don’t know, i always grasp for some descriptors when it comes to the hop flavors) lingering hop on the back of my tongue.

The notes on the menu said this was from a homebrew recipe that was then brewed at Dry Dock. Apparently it won some award at the Vail Belgian and Big Beer Festival this year, whatever. My friend tells me that ragnarok is Celtic for apocalypse which I found slightly impressive. As for the beer, it was a nice ruby-red color with a creamy head on top. It smelled sweet. The taste was sweet, caramel, with a hint of bitterness. The mouthfeel was perfect, I kept swishing it around my mouth on every drink. This was a very good beer. Serving type: on-tap Reviewed on: 07-23-2007 15:29:25

Tasted on tap Dec. 20, 2008, 2 years old. Pour was a beautiful orangey color, tan head and tight lace, with a very mild malt and hop aroma. This one has aged well. I believe this is the last keg, and I showed up to try it based on their low quantities warning email. The flavor -- amazing apricots, leather, malt, and citrusy bitter c-hop with a nice finish. the texture in mouth was perfect. This is definitely one of the all-time top barleywines of the many I have tasted. So smooth. They tell me it is 10% ABV, but you would never know. Just wow!

On tap at the 2007 GABF: Pours a clear golden bronze with a thin ring of off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel and toffee with a hint of light fruity esters. Body starts with nice sticky malty sweetness and good light fruity complexity with some warming alcohol toward the finish. Could use a little aging.

GABF 2007: Poured a hazy brown-amber color. Sweet and fruity aroma with notes of apples. The flavor was of old fruit and aged malt. Some piney notes. Moderate bitterness. Good warming sensation. Was told this was 11% ABV.

Date: 10/12/2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, GABF opaque light orange, frothy off white head, sweet and fruity dark caramel malt aroma, rich caramel malt flavor, nice fruity character, good earthy balance, lasting fruity finish, Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 14/20 Rating: 3.6/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: ***/4

Draft at The Falling Rock in Denver. Poured a clear dark orange-brown color. Head was thin and off white. Aroma was fruity, but subdued overall, and reminded me of a combination of apple and pear. Syrupy sweet on the tongue. Fruity and boozy, like pear and mixed fruit liqueur. Not much complexity.

Draught at Falling Rock. Beer is clear, medium red-brown with a small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing but lasting head.First aromatic impression is boozy, jammy fruit. Otherwise breaks down to being malty with light notes of toasted grain, biscuit, caramel, moderately weighty, slightly buttery toasted bread crust; Hoppy with light floral notes, traces of orange zest, lemon zest; Yeasty with a light note of basement; Moderate miscellaneous note of boozy black stone fruit, spicy wood and alcohol.The flavor is moderately/heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter with a long, moderately sweet, trace bitter, lightly acidic finish.The body is medium/full, the texture is velvety and the carbonation is soft.Fair, not striking.

On tap @ Dry Dock poured a clear copper brown with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of toffee, light carmel and some interesting fruity notes. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, toffee, toasted malt and a hint of dark fruit with a lingering dry bitter finish.

tap. pour is maroon and frothy. this is one of those examples of why i am rating less. i enjoyed the hell out of this, but i just don’t have anything new to say. more of a sweet barleywine, loved the strawberry notes in it. chose this over the vanilla porter, and i think everyone knows how i feel about that beer. some bubblicious flavors too, a lot of candy here. some citrus that works well. a nice one, and i hope to try it again in october, if not before.
Draught at Brauhaus. Clear yellow - white head. Grains, hay, light cactus, malty, some sweetness, light finish. Nice.

Draught at the Brauhaus. Black - offwhite head. Aroma: Raisins, caramel, berries, chokolate, light coffee. Taste: Very smooth, dried dark fruits, coffee, sweetness, light burned, rastedness, light mould. Nice !!
Nice little flavor of coffee. As the name implies is an easy drinking beer. Good for ending a late night with a few dozen of these, or with sunday brunch. Flavorful low alcohol beer.
the beer looks like swamp water and has very little head. It has a big aroma of coffee and a little burnt malt aroma. The flavor also has a huge espresso scent and a tiny spice on the finish.

Almost opaque, filmy head. Nice roast chickory aroma - straightforward. Flavor is like sucking on a used coffee filter. No sweetness, lightly tart. A few nutty notes, but mostly coffee. Finishes quickly without coffee cling, which was surprising given the flavor.

Pours a lightly hazy brownish amber with a medium creamy/lacing light tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, on the lighter side but pleasant. Flavor was all coffee, actually reminded me of a chilled coffee. Actually wrote that before I noticed this one is blended with espresso...nice.

Tap at Nodding Head. Hazy copper/brown with a medium head. Good lacing. Tastes like chocolate and espresso, but mild. Good balance of sweet and bitter. My first ’mild ale’; I don’t know if it sticks to the style or not. But it’s a pretty good brew.

so i’ve had close to 900 beers and i’ve never felt more confident in my ability to describe a beer. buy a coffee frappucino from startbucks. drink the whole thing. then let the ice melt and drink it again. that is what this beer tastes like. watered down coffee. nnt what i want in a beer.

Draft at the brewpub. Deep brown color with a moderate sized tan head. coffee and malt aroma. Nice malt sweetness, well accentuated by coffee flavor. really flavorful; i can’t wait to go back to the brewpub for more.

Tap at brewery. Hickory smoke and cocoa malt aroma - love the smell of this beer. Hazy dark brown color with a creamy head. Not much flavor initially but then a pleasant wood smoke and mocha flavor kicks in. I really enjoyed this beer. Well named - I could drink this beer all night.

Hand-bottle sample shared by Chuck. The beer pours to a glowing amber body with no head. The aroma is strange. Grape jelly and dankness. The flavor is not too bad. Simple pale malts and simple sweet hops. Not interesting with an average palate. Pass.
Hand-bottled sample thanks to Chuck. Smells like old concord grape jelly and cardboardy malt. The flavor is weak & watery - light caramel malt and light lactic acid; finishes with leafy bitterness.

Reddish almost cough syrupy color w/ a tiny whisp of head. weird aroma some light toasty malts very light.. can’t really place the odd aroma. Palate is water. Flavor is very light some corn like aroams a good caramel a touch of toast... very light.. easy to drink... serve it cold it would go right down.

Sample at the brewpub. This brew is a clear amber-orange color with a thin off-white head that diminishes quickly. Thin sheet of lace. Mildly malty aroma with touches of fruit. Light, smooth body with a sweet toasted malt character along with slight hops and citrus flavors. The finish is short and sweetly malty with a bit of a hops aftertaste. Just average overall.

Draft at brewpub. Poured dark amber with an average frothy white head that diminished slowly with fair lacing. Moderate toasted malty and sour citrus aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium bitter flavor with a medium smooth bittersweet finish of moderate duration.
Tap at freo beer fest. Refreshing ginger beer. Doesn't linger too much on the palate. Goes down easy ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tough to beat on a hot summer day in Perth. Fantastic when combined with spicy Asian food.
